mapf_simulation.visualizerGraphicItem

To add a new kind of graphic items create a child class of VisualizerGraphicItem in this file and add it in the model.create_item function to the model. This is the only function in the model that should be changed. The behaivor and values of the object should be defindes inside of its own class.

To add new properties to a class modify the attributes of a class and modify the following methods to adjust the objects behaivor: reset, do_action, undo_action, ros_publish_message_info. To adjust the appearance of an item modify the set_rect method. Note: The set_color function is called automatically by the modelView for every item if the colors are defined in the configuration.

Look at the method definitions of other classes for examples.

   1"""
   2To add a new kind of graphic items create a **child class
   3of VisualizerGraphicItem** in this file and add it in the 
   4**model.create_item** function to the model. This is the only function 
   5in the model that should be changed. The behaivor and values of the
   6object should be defindes inside of its own class.
   7
   8To add new properties to a class modify the attributes of a class
   9and modify the following methods to adjust the objects behaivor:
  10 **reset**, **do_action**, **undo_action**, **ros_publish_message_info**. 
  11To adjust the appearance of an item modify the **set_rect** method.
  12Note: The set_color function is called automatically by the modelView for
  13every item if the colors are defined in the configuration.
  14
  15Look at the method definitions of other classes for examples.
  16"""

  38VIZ_STATE_MOVED     = 0x0001
  39VIZ_STATE_MOVE      = 0x0010
  40VIZ_STATE_ACTION    = 0xffff
  41#VIZ_STATE_DELIVERED = 0x0002
  42#VIZ_STATE_PICKED_UP = 0x0004
  43#VIZ_STATE_PUT_DOWN  = 0x0008
  44#VIZ_STATE_DELIVER   = 0x0020
  45#VIZ_STATE_PICK_UP   = 0x0040
  46#VIZ_STATE_PUT_DOWN2 = 0x0080
  47#VIZ_STATE_CHARGED   = 0x0100

  50def calculate_color(first_color, second_color, multiplier):
  51    """
  52    This function interpolates between two color values.
  53
  54    :return: QtGui.QColor()
  55    """
  56
  57    red = (min(first_color.red(), second_color.red()), 
  58            max(first_color.red(), second_color.red()))
  59    green = (min(first_color.green(), second_color.green()), 
  60            max(first_color.green(), second_color.green()))
  61    blue = (min(first_color.blue(), second_color.blue()), 
  62            max(first_color.blue(), second_color.blue()))
  63    return QColor(
  64                red[0] + (red[1] - red[0]) * multiplier,
  65                green[0] + (green[1] - green[0]) * multiplier,
  66                blue[0] + (blue[1] - blue[0]) * multiplier)

  69class VisualizerGraphicItem(QGraphicsItem, mapf_simulation.visualizerItem.VisualizerItem):
  70    """
  71    This is the template class for visualizer graphic items.
  72    There should never be an instance of this class.
  73    A visualizer graphic item is a part of the visualizer model
  74    that is drawn on the model view and can perform actions.
  75
  76    **Attributes**:
  77    -   **_kind_name**: str         -   The name of this kind of object.
  78    -   **_ID**: int                -   The id of this object.
  79    -   **_model**: model.Model     -   The model this object belongs to
  80    -   **_position**: tuple        -   A tuple that consists of two integers representing
  81                                        the position of the item on the grid.
  82    -   **_start_position**: tuple  -   The position of this item at timestep 0.
  83    -   **_dragged**: tuple         -   This is the position of this item before a drag
  84                                        action started.
  85    -   **_enable_drag**: bool      -   This is true if drag and drop is enabled for this item.        
  86                                        This will be set by the model. 
  87    -   **_graphics_item**: QGraphicsItem - This is the main graphic item of this item
  88                                            and is used for some default functions.
  89    -   **_text**: QGraphicsTextItem -  This is a text item that is drawn 
  90                                        on the model view and represents primarily the id of the item.
  91    -   **_actions**: list          -   This is a sorted list of the actions of this item. The index
  92                                        of every action is the time step at which the action occurs.    
  93    -   **_color**: QColor          -   The current main color of the item.
  94    -   **_colors**: list           -   A list of QColor values. Contains several colors for multi-colored
  95                                        items and color interpolation.
  96    -   **_display_mode**: int      -   This is set by the model view and determines whether
  97                                        the item text should be rendered and whether the item 
  98                                        should be rendered in the whole grid field.
  99                                        It is primarily defined by the zoom factor and the grid size.
 100    -   **_draw_path**: bool        -   This is true if the driven path of the item should be drawn in the simulation. 
 101                                        Should only be used for items that can have a path like robots.
 102    -   **_draw_future_path**: bool -   This is true if the calculated path for the item should be drawn in the simulation. 
 103                                        Should only be used for items that can have a path like robots.
 104    -   **_draw_startpoint**: bool  -   This is true if the start point of the item should be drawn in the simulation. 
 105                                        Should only be used for items that can have a start point like robots.
 106    -   **_state**: int             -   Consists of one or more state flags, that describes which action
 107                                        a item is currently doing.
 108    -   **_highlighted**: bool      -   This is true if the item will be highlighted.
 109                                        Highlighted elements are displayed larger
 110
 111.
 112    """
 113
 114    def __init__(self, ID = 0, x = 0, y = 0):
 115        """
 116        :param ID: int, optional    - The ID of the item
 117        :param x:  int, optional    - The x coordinate on the grid
 118        :param y:  int, optional    - The y coordinate on the grid
 119        """
 120        QGraphicsItem.__init__(self)
 121        mapf_simulation.visualizerItem.VisualizerItem.__init__(self)
 122
 123        self._kind_name = ''
 124        self._id = ID
 125        self._model = None
 126        self._position = (x, y)
 127        self._start_position = (x, y)
 128
 129        self._dragged = None
 130        self._enable_drag = False
 131
 132        self._graphics_item = None  
 133        self._text = None
 134        self._pen = None
 135            
 136        self._actions = []
 137        self._future_path = []
 138
 139        self._color = None
 140        self._colors = [QColor(0,0,0)]
 141        self._display_mode = 0
 142
 143        self._draw_path = False
 144        self._draw_future_path = False
 145        self._draw_startpoint = False
 146        self.setAcceptedMouseButtons(Qt.MouseButtons(1))
 147
 148        self._state = 0x00
 149        self._highlighted = False

 152    #SET FUNCTIONS
 153    def set_starting_position(self, x, y):
 154        """
 155        Sets the starting position of an item.
 156
 157        :param x:  int      - The x coordinate on the grid
 158        :param y:  int      - The y coordinate on the grid
 159        """
 160        self._start_position = (x, y)
 161
 162    def set_position(self, x, y):
 163        """
 164        Sets the current position of an item.
 165
 166        :param x:  int      - The x coordinate on the grid
 167        :param y:  int      - The y coordinate on the grid
 168        """
 169        self._position = (x, y)
 170
 171    def set_color(self, color, color_id = 0):
 172        """
 173        Sets a specific color of an item.
 174
 175        :param color: QColor    - The color
 176        :param color_id:  int   - The id of the color that will be set
 177        """
 178        while color_id >= len(self._colors):
 179            self._colors.append(QColor(0,0,0))
 180        self._colors[color_id] = color
 181
 182    def set_rect(self, rect):
 183        """
 184        Sets the rectangle that an item can use to draw things in.
 185        This equals usually one field of the grid in the model view.
 186        This function usually defines the appearance of an item
 187        on the grid.
 188
 189        :param rect: QtCore.QRect   - The rectangle that an item can use to draw things in.
 190        """
 191        return
 192
 193    def set_action(self, action, time_step):
 194        """
 195        Sets the action for the specific time step.
 196        Overrides existing actions at the time step but prints out
 197        a warning since this should never happen.
 198
 199        :param action:      mapf_simulation.action.Action   -   This is the action that will be performed.
 200        :param time_step:   int                             -   This is the time step at which the action should be performed.
 201        """
 202        if time_step < 0:
 203            print(('Warning: invalid time step in occurs(object('
 204                    + str(self._kind_name) + ','
 205                    + str(self._id) + '),' + str(action)
 206                    + ',' + str(time_step) + ')'))
 207            print('time step is less than 0')
 208            return
 209        for ii in range((time_step + 1) - len(self._actions)):
 210            self._actions.append(None)
 211        if not self._actions[time_step] == None:
 212            print(('Warning: for object(' + str(self._kind_name)
 213                    + ', ' + str(self._id)
 214                    + ') multiple actions are defined at time step '
 215                    + str(time_step)))
 216        self._actions[time_step] = action
 217

 219        """
 220        Sets the current display mode.
 221
 222        :param display_mode: int   - display mode (usually 0 or 1)
 223        """
 224
 225        self._display_mode =  display_mode

 315
 316    def get_action(self, time_step):
 317        """
 318        Returns the action at a specific time step.
 319        Returns None if no action is defined for this time step.
 320
 321        :param time_step:   int                      -   The time step for which the action should be returned.
 322        :return: **mapf_simulation.action.Action**   -   The action at a specific time step.
 323        """
 324        if time_step >= len(self._actions):
 325            return None  #break, if no action is defined
 326        if self._actions[time_step] == None:
 327            return None  #break, if no action is defined     
 328        return self._actions[time_step]

 336        return self._future_path

 379    #EVENTS
 380    def mousePressEvent(self, event):
 381        """
 382        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
 383        """
 384        if self._enable_drag:
 385            rect = self.get_rect()
 386            self._dragged = (event.scenePos().x(),
 387                             event.scenePos().y())
 388        event.accept()
 389
 390    def mouseReleaseEvent(self, event):
 391        """
 392        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
 393        """
 394        model_view = None
 395        if self._dragged is not None:
 396            self._dragged = None
 397            for view in self.scene().views():
 398                if isinstance(view, mapf_simulation.modelView.ModelView):
 399                    model_view = view
 400        if model_view is None:
 401            return
 402        node = model_view.scene_coordinates_to_node(event.scenePos().x(),
 403                                                    event.scenePos().y())
 404        
 405        self.setPos(0, 0)
 406
 407        if node is not None:
 408            self.edit_position_to(node[0], node[1])
 409        
 410        model_view.update()
 411        event.accept()
 412
 413    def mouseMoveEvent(self, event):
 414        """
 415        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
 416        """
 417        if self._dragged is None:
 418            return
 419        self.setPos(event.scenePos().x() - self._dragged[0], 
 420                    event.scenePos().y() - self._dragged[1])
 421        event.accept()
 422

 432        :param pattern: int -   Not used.
 433        """
 434        return

 444    def do_action(self, time_step):
 445        """
 446        Action handler. Must be implemented for items
 447        which can perform actions. This function will be called
 448        every time the model does one time step forward.

 450        :param time_step:   int     -   The time step for which the action should be executed.

 455    def undo_action(self, time_step):
 456        """
 457        Reverse action handler. Must be implemented for items
 458        which can perform actions. This function will be called 
 459        every time the model does one time step backwards.
 460
 461        :param time_step:   int     -   The time step for which the action should be reversed.
 462        """
 463
 464        return
 465
 466    def clear_actions(self):
 467        """
 468        Deletes all actions for an object.
 469        """
 470
 471        self._actions = []
 472
 473    def clear_older_actions(self, time_step):
 474        """
 475        Deletes all actions for the given time step (self._actions[time_step]) 
 476        and after the given time step (self._actions[i>time_step]) for an object.
 477        
 478        :param time_step:   int -   Sets the steps (time>=time_step) for which the actions should be deleted.
 479        """
 480        if len(self._actions) == 0:
 481            return
 482        if len(self._actions)-1 < time_step:
 483            return
 484        if time_step == 0:
 485            self._actions = []
 486            return
 487    
 488        self._actions = self._actions[0:time_step]
 489        return
 490        
 491    def restart(self):
 492        """
 493        Resets the item to its original values.
 494        Sets the items position to its starting position.
 495        """
 496        self._position = self._start_position
 497
 498    def reset(self):
 499        """
 500        Resets the item to its original values. This function will be called for every item if 
 501        the Button "RESET" in the GUI is pressed
 502        """
 503        return

 506    #MOVE / DRAG
 507    def edit_position_to(self, x, y):
 508        """
 509        Sets a new starting position and new current position for an 
 510        item. If an item of the same kind is already on the same position
 511        they swap positions. This function is used to edit instances with
 512        the drag and drop feature.
 513        
 514        :param x:  int      - The x coordinate on the grid
 515        :param y:  int      - The y coordinate on the grid
 516        """
 517        
 518        if (x, y) == self._position:
 519            return
 520        item2 = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = self._kind_name,
 521                                        position = (x,y),
 522                                        return_first = True)[0]
 523        if item2 is not None:
 524            item2.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
 525            item2.set_starting_position(
 526                self._position[0], 
 527                self._position[1])
 528            item2.clear_actions()
 529        
 530        self.set_position(x,y)
 531        self.set_starting_position(x, y)
 532        self.get_model().reset()
 533        self.get_model().mapf_reset_connection()
 534
 535    def enable_drag(self, enable):
 536        """
 537        Enables and disables the drag and drop feature for the
 538        model editor.
 539        
 540        :param enable: bool  -   enable or disable drag & drop
 541        """     
 542        self._enable_drag = enable
 543
 544    def boundingRect(self):
 545        """
 546        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
 547        """
 548        return self._graphics_item.boundingRect()

 553        """
 554        Must be implemented for items which should publish the information about itself through ROS2 interfaces.
 555        This function will be called by the model every time an item does an action forward and has to publish
 556        the updated information about itself.
 557
 558        :param msg_id:      int  -   The id of the current cycle (sim->controller->planner->controller->sim)
 559        :param time_step:   int  -   Sets the time step in the published message (msg.step = time_step)
 560        """
 561        return

 564class RobotROS(Node, VisualizerGraphicItem):
 565    """
 566    This class represents a robot.
 567
 568    **Attributes**:
 569    -   **_kind_name**: str                     -   The name of this kind of item. This is always 'robot_ros'.
 570    -   **_tasks**:    list                    -   The list of tasks of the robot.
 571    -   **_graphics_item**: QGraphicsEllipseItem-   This is the main graphic item of the robot
 572                                                    and is used for some default functions.
 573    -   **_text**:          QGraphicsTextItem   -   This is a text item that is drawn on the model view
 574                                                    and represents primarily the id of the robot.
 575    """
 576
 577    def __init__(self, ID = 0, x = 0, y = 0, theta = 0.0, bucket = 0, heuristic = 0.0):
 578        """
 579        :param ID:      int, optional       - The ID of the robot
 580        :param x:       int, optional       - The x coordinate on the grid
 581        :param y:       int, optional       - The y coordinate on the grid
 582        :param theta:   float, optional     - The orientation of the robot in angle (°)
 583        :param bucket:  int, optional       - The bucket to which the robot belongs
 584        :param heuristic: float, optional   - Optimal length from the start to the goal position
 585        """
 586
 587        #------------------------------ ROS2 --------------------------------------------------------------
 588        #Init ROS2 Node with the name mapf_robot_ID, here ID is the ID of the robot
 589        Node.__init__(self, 'mapf_robot_' + str(ID) + '_node')
 590
 591        #Create a publisher for the topic "mapf_robot_info_ID" to publish the information 
 592        #of the robot with the custom message type "RobotInfo.msg"
 593        self.publisher = self.create_publisher(RobotInfo, 'mapf_robot_info_' + str(ID) , 1)
 594        '''**rclpy.publisher.Publisher** - ros2 publisher to the topic */mapf_robot_info_''ID''*'''
 595
 596        #Create a subscriber for the topic "mapf_robot_action_ID" to get the information about 
 597        #the next action to be executed by the robot, custom message type: RobotAction.msg
 598        self.subscriber = self.create_subscription(RobotAction, 'mapf_robot_action_' + str(ID) , self.callback_action, 100)
 599        '''**rclpy.subscription.Subscription** - ros2 subscriber to the topic */mapf_robot_action_''ID''*'''
 600
 601        #True if RobotAction.msg received for the next step, otherwise False
 602        self._ready = False
 603
 604
 605        #------------------------------ GRAPHIC ITEM ------------------------------------------------------
 606        VisualizerGraphicItem.__init__(self, ID, x, y)
 607        self._kind_name = 'robot_ros'
 608        self._tasks = []
 609        
 610        self._graphics_item = QGraphicsEllipseItem(self)
 611        self._graphics_line_item = QGraphicsLineItem(self)
 612        self._text = QGraphicsTextItem(self)
 613        self._pen = QPen()
 614        self.setZValue(2.0)
 615        
 616        self._draw_path = True
 617        self._draw_future_path = True
 618        self._draw_startpoint = True
 619        
 620        #------------------------------ SAVE DATA ------------------------------------------------------
 621        self.set_position(x,y,theta)
 622        self.set_starting_position(x,y,theta)
 623        self.set_bucket(bucket)
 624        self.set_heuristic(heuristic)
 625
 626        self._step = -1
 627
 628    '''    
 629    def __del__(self):
 630        self.destroy_node()
 631    '''

 633    #SET FUNCTIONS
 634    def set_starting_position(self, x, y, theta = 0.0):
 635        """
 636        Sets the starting position of the robot.
 637
 638        :param x:       int                 - The x coordinate on the grid
 639        :param y:       int                 - The y coordinate on the grid
 640        :param theta:   float, optional     - The orientation of the robot in angle (°)
 641        """
 642        self._start_position = (x, y, theta)
 643
 644    def set_position(self, x, y, theta=0.0):
 645        """
 646        Sets the position of the robot.
 647
 648        :param x:       int                - The x coordinate on the grid
 649        :param y:       int                - The y coordinate on the grid
 650        :param theta:   float, optional    - The orientation of the robot in angle (°)
 651        """
 652        self._position = (x, y, theta)
 653
 654    def set_theta(self, theta = 0.0):
 655        """
 656        Sets the orientation of the robot.
 657
 658        :param theta:   float, optional      - The orientation of the robot in angle (°).
 659        """
 660        self._position = (self._position[0], self._position[1], theta)
 661
 662    def set_bucket(self, bucket = 0):
 663        """
 664        Assign the robot to a certain bucket.
 665
 666        :param bucket:   int, optional      - The number of the bucket
 667        """
 668        self._bucket = bucket
 669
 670    def set_ready(self, ready = False):
 671        """
 672        Sets the state of the robot (READY or NOT READY).  
 673        (A robot is READY if he knows what action he should execute as next)  
 674        (A robot is not READY if he still has not received an Action from the CONTROLLER for the next time step)  
 675
 676        :param ready:   bool, optional    - True or False
 677        """
 678        self._ready = ready
 679
 680    def set_heuristic(self, heuristic = 0.0):
 681        """
 682        Assign the optimal length for the robot from his start to his goal.
 683
 684        :param heuristic:   float, optional - The optimal length for the robot from his start to his goal.
 685        """
 686        self._heuristic = heuristic
 687
 688    def set_future_path(self, path):
 689        """
 690        Assign/Save the calculated path for the robot.
 691
 692        :param path:   list of **mapf_interfaces.msg.Position** -    The calculated path for the robot.
 693        """
 694        self._future_path = path      
 695
 696    def set_action(self, action, time_step):
 697        """
 698        Sets the action for the specific time step.
 699        Overrides existing actions at the time step but prints out
 700        a warning since this should never happen.
 701
 702        :param action:      mapf_simulation.action.Action   -   This is the action that will be performed.
 703        :param time_step:   int                             -   This is the time step at which the action should be performed.
 704        """
 705        
 706        
 707        print("----------------------------------- SET ACTION -----------------------------------")
 708        if time_step < 0:
 709            print('Warning: invalid time step(smaller than 0), Object: ' 
 710                  + str(self._kind_name) + 
 711                  ', ID: ' + str(self._id) + 
 712                  ', Action: ' + str(action.get_name()) + 
 713                  ', Value: ' + str(action.get_value()) + 
 714                  ', Time Step: ' + str(time_step))
 715            print('time step is less than 0')
 716            return
 717        for ii in range((time_step + 1) - len(self._actions)):
 718            self._actions.append(None)
 719        if not self._actions[time_step] == None:
 720            print(('Warning: for object(' + str(self._kind_name)
 721                    + ', ' + str(self._id)
 722                    + ') multiple actions are defined at time step '
 723                    + str(time_step)))
 724        self._actions[time_step] = action

 799    def get_rect(self):
 800        """
 801        Returns the current rectangle of the robot. 
 802
 803        :return: **QtCore.QRect** - The adjusted current rectangle of the QGraphicsItem which should represent the robot.
 804        """
 805        if self._display_mode == 0:
 806            rect = self._graphics_item.rect()
 807            width = rect.width()*2
 808            height = rect.height()*2
 809            rect.setLeft(rect.x() - 0.25*width)
 810            rect.setTop(rect.y() - 0.25*height)
 811            rect.setWidth(width)
 812            rect.setHeight(height)
 813            return rect
 814        elif self._display_mode == 1:
 815            rect = self._graphics_item.rect()
 816            width = rect.width()/0.9
 817            height = rect.height()/0.9
 818            rect.setLeft(rect.x() - 0.05*width)
 819            rect.setTop(rect.y() - 0.05*height)
 820            rect.setWidth(width)
 821            rect.setHeight(height)
 822            return rect

 827        (A robot is READY if he knows what action he should execute as next)  
 828        (A robot is not READY if he still has not received an Action from the CONTROLLER for the next time step) 
 829        
 830        :return: **bool**   -   True or False.
 831        """

 835    #EVENTS (Drag&Drop)
 836    def mouseReleaseEvent(self, event):
 837        """
 838        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
 839        """
 840        model_view = None
 841        self._dragged = None
 842        for view in self.scene().views():
 843            if isinstance(view, mapf_simulation.modelView.ModelView):
 844                model_view = view
 845        if model_view is None:
 846            return
 847        node = model_view.scene_coordinates_to_node(event.scenePos().x(),
 848                                                    event.scenePos().y())
 849        self.setPos(0, 0)
 850
 851        if node is not None:
 852            #if item not moved but only clicked then highlight it and all the corresponding checkpoints
 853            if (self._position[0] == node[0] and self._position[1] == node[1]):
 854                self._highlighted = not self._highlighted
 855                for task in self._tasks:
 856                    for checkpoint, name in task.get_checkpoints():
 857                        checkpoint.set_highlighted(self._highlighted)
 858            elif self._enable_drag:
 859                if self._model.is_node_free_of_robots(node[0], node[1]):
 860                    self.edit_position_to(node[0], node[1])
 861        model_view.update()
 862        event.accept()
 863
 864    def edit_position_to(self, x, y):
 865        """
 866        Sets a new starting position and new current position for the 
 867        robot. If another robot is already on the same position
 868        they swap positions. This function is used to edit instances with
 869        the drag and drop feature. 
 870
 871        :param x:       int                - The x coordinate on the grid (new position for the robot)
 872        :param y:       int                - The y coordinate on the grid (new position for the robot)
 873        """
 874        if (x == self._position[0] and y == self._position[1]):
 875            return
 876        item2 = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = self._kind_name,
 877                                        position = (x,y),
 878                                        return_first = True)[0]
 879        
 880        if item2 is not None:
 881            item2.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
 882            item2.set_starting_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
 883            #item2.clear_actions()
 884        self.set_position(x,y, self.get_theta())
 885        self.set_starting_position(x, y, self.get_theta())
 886        #self.clear_actions()
 887
 888        self.get_model().reset()
 889        self.get_model().mapf_reset_connection()
 890
 891
 892    #VISUAL
 893    def set_rect(self, rect):
 894        """    
 895        Sets the rectangle that a robot can use to draw things in.
 896        This equals one field of the grid in the model view.
 897        This function defines the appearance of the robot
 898        on the grid.
 899
 900        :param rect:    QtCore.QRect    - The rectangle that a robot can use to draw things in.
 901        """
 902        scale = config.get('display', 'id_font_scale')
 903        bold = config.get('display', 'id_font_bold')
 904
 905        #SET FONTSIZE, TEXT POSITION AND DEFAULT TEXT COLOR
 906        self._text.setFont(QFont('', rect.width()*0.3*scale))
 907        self._text.setPos(rect.x(), rect.y() + 0.1*rect.height())
 908        self._text.setDefaultTextColor(QColor(config.get('display', 'id_font_color')))
 909
 910        #SET DISPLAY MODE
 911        if self._display_mode == 0:
 912            if bold:
 913                self._text.setHtml('<b>' + str(self._id) + '</b>')
 914            else:
 915                self._text.setHtml(str(self._id))
 916        else:
 917            self._text.setPlainText('')
 918
 919        #SET POSITION AND SIZE OF GRAPHICS ITEM INSIDE THE CELL 
 920        rect2 = QRectF()
 921        rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.05*rect.width(), 
 922                            rect.y() + 0.05*rect.height(),
 923                            rect.width()*0.9,
 924                            rect.height()*0.9)
 925        
 926        self._pen.setWidth(rect.width()*0.1)
 927        
 928        #IF HIGHLIGHTED
 929        if self._highlighted:
 930            rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.0*rect.width(), 
 931                            rect.y() + 0.0*rect.height(),
 932                            rect.width()*1.0,
 933                            rect.height()*1.0)
 934            self._pen.setWidth(rect.width()*0.25)
 935            
 936        self._graphics_item.setRect(rect2)
 937        self._graphics_item.setPen(self._pen)
 938
 939        try:
 940            action = self._actions[self._step+1].arguments[0]
 941            value = self._actions[self._step+1].arguments[1]
 942            if action.name == 'move' and len(value.arguments) == 2:
 943                try:
 944                    move_x = value.arguments[0].number
 945                    move_y = value.arguments[1].number
 946                    if not (move_x == 0 and move_y == 0):
 947                        self.set_theta(math.atan2(float(move_y),float(move_x))*180.0/math.pi)    
 948                except:
 949                    pass
 950        except:
 951            pass
 952        
 953        #DRAW THE RIGHT ORIENTATION OF THE ROBOT IN THE DIRECTION OF MOVING
 954        self._graphics_line_item.setLine(rect2.x() + rect2.width()  *0.5,   #start x
 955                                         rect2.y() + rect2.height() *0.5,  #start y 
 956                                         rect2.x() + rect2.width()  *0.5 + math.cos(self._position[2]/180*math.pi)* rect2.width()*0.5,      #end x
 957                                         rect2.y() + rect2.height() *0.5 + math.sin(self._position[2]/180*math.pi)* rect2.height()*0.5)      #end y                                  
 958        #UPDATE TOOLTIP
 959        self.update_tooltip()
 960
 961    def update_tooltip(self):
 962        """
 963        Updates the tooltip for the robot.
 964        """
 965        tooltip = ("robot(" + str(self._id) + 
 966                   ")\nPosition: " + str(self.get_position()))
 967        self.setToolTip(tooltip)

 969    def determine_color(self, number, count, pattern = None):
 970        """
 971        Determines the color of the robot.
 972        
 973        :param number: int  -   The number of this item in the models sequence. 
 974                                This does not necessarily have to be the ID of the item.
 975        :param count: int   -   The maximal count of all items in the model of this kind.
 976        :param pattern: int -   Not used.
 977        """
 978        color = calculate_color(self._colors[0], self._colors[1], (float)(number)/count)
 979        self._color = color
 980        brush = QBrush(color)
 981        self._graphics_item.setBrush(brush)

 984    #ACTIONS / UPDATE   
 985    def clear_actions(self):
 986        """
 987        Deletes all saved actions for the robot.
 988        """
 989        self._actions = []
 990
 991    def do_action(self, time_step):
 992        """
 993        Executes an action for the robot.
 994        This function will be called every time the model does
 995        one time step forward.
 996        
 997        :param time_step:   int     - The time step for which an action should be executed.
 998        :return:   **int**          - 1 if an action was done and 0 if an error occured.
 999        """
1000        self._state = self._state & ~VIZ_STATE_ACTION
1001
1002        #SETS THE STATE FOR THE NEXT ACTION
1003        if time_step + 1 < len(self._actions):
1004            if self._actions[time_step + 1] is not None:
1005                #SETS THE STATE FOR THE NEXT ACTION
1006                self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVE
1007        
1008        if time_step >= len(self._actions):
1009            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1010        if self._actions[time_step] is None:
1011            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1012        if self._model is None:
1013            return 0
1014
1015        #TRY TO GET THE ACTION
1016        try:
1017            action = self._actions[time_step].arguments[0]
1018            value = self._actions[time_step].arguments[1]
1019        except:
1020            return 0
1021
1022        #EXECUTE ACTION
1023        if action.name == 'move':
1024            if len(value.arguments) != 2: 
1025                return 0
1026          
1027            #MOVE 
1028            try:
1029                move_x = value.arguments[0].number
1030                move_y = value.arguments[1].number
1031                #MOVE AND CHANGE ORIENTATION IF VALUE NOT ZERO
1032                if not (move_x == 0 and move_y == 0):
1033                    self.set_position(self._position[0] + move_x, self._position[1] + move_y, math.atan2(float(move_y),float(move_x))*180.0/math.pi)
1034                    self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVED
1035            except:
1036                #NO ACTION, NO CHANGE IN POSITION
1037                self.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1], self._position[2])
1038            
1039            #MARK VISITED CHECKPOINTS
1040            for task in self._tasks:
1041                for checkpoint, name in task.get_checkpoints():
1042                    pos = checkpoint.get_position()
1043                    if pos[0] == self._position[0] and pos[1] == self._position[1]:
1044                        task.visit_checkpoint(checkpoint)
1045                        break
1046
1047            self._step = time_step
1048            return 1
1049        return 0
1050
1051    def undo_action(self, time_step):
1052        """
1053        Reverse an executed action for the robot.
1054        This function will be called every time the model does
1055        one time step backwards.  
1056
1057        :param time_step:   int     - The time step for which an action should be reversed.
1058        :return:   **int**          - 1 if an action was done and 0 if an error occured.
1059        """
1060        self._state = self._state & ~VIZ_STATE_ACTION
1061        if time_step >= len(self._actions):  
1062            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1063        if self._actions[time_step] == None: 
1064            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1065        if self._model is None:
1066            return 0
1067
1068        try:
1069            action = self._actions[time_step].arguments[0]
1070            value = self._actions[time_step].arguments[1]
1071        except:
1072            return 0
1073
1074        #EXECUTE ACTION
1075        if action.name == 'move':
1076            if len(value.arguments) != 2: 
1077                return 0
1078            
1079            #UNMARK VISITED CHECKPOINTS
1080            for task in self._tasks:
1081                for checkpoint in task.get_checkpoints():
1082                    #checkpoint[0] -> checkpoint object, checkpoint[1] -> name of the checkpoint
1083                    checkpoint = checkpoint[0]
1084                    pos = checkpoint.get_position()
1085                    if pos[0] == self._position[0] and pos[1] == self._position[1]:
1086                        task.unvisit_checkpoint(checkpoint)
1087                        break
1088
1089            #MOVE BACK
1090            try:
1091                move_x = value.arguments[0].number
1092                move_y = value.arguments[1].number
1093                #MOVE BACK AND CHANGE ORIENTATION IF VALUE NOT ZERO
1094                if not (move_x == 0 and move_y == 0):
1095                    self.set_position(self._position[0] - move_x, self._position[1] - move_y, math.atan2(float(move_y),float(move_x))*180.0/math.pi)
1096                    self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVE
1097            except:
1098                #NO ACTION, NO CHANGE IN POSITION
1099                self.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1], self._position[2])
1100            
1101            return 1
1102        return 0
1103
1104    def reset(self):
1105        """
1106        Resets the item to its original values. This function will be called for every item if 
1107        the Button "RESET" in the GUI is pressed
1108        -   delete old actions for the robot
1109        -   move the robot back to it's start position
1110        -   mark all the checkpoints of the robot as not visited yet
1111        """
1112        self.clear_actions()
1113        self.set_position(self._start_position[0], self._start_position[1], self._start_position[2])
1114        self.unvisit_all_checkpoints()
1115
1116    def restart(self):
1117        """
1118        Sets the robot to it's starting position.
1119        """
1120        super(self.__class__, self).restart()
1121

1123    #TASK / CHECKPOINTS
1124    def add_task(self, task):
1125        """
1126        Adds a task to the robot (For the moment only one task is supported).
1127
1128        :param task:   mapf_simulation.visualizerItem.TaskROS  -    A new task for the robot
1129        """
1130        if task is None:
1131            return
1132        if task in self._tasks:
1133            return
1134        self._tasks.append(task)
1135        task.set_robot(self)
1136
1137    def check_robot_at_target(self):
1138        """
1139        This function checks whether the robot has reached it's target. 
1140        At the moment for one robot only one checkpoint and only one task are supported.
1141        Therefore this function checks only if the robot has reached the position 
1142        of the first checkpoint from it's first task from his task list.
1143        
1144        :return: **True**   -   if the robot has reached it's target   
1145                 **False**  -   otherwise
1146        """
1147        task = self.get_task(index =0)
1148        checkpoint = task.get_checkpoints()[0][0]
1149        if (checkpoint.get_position()[0] == self.get_position()[0] and 
1150            checkpoint.get_position()[1] == self.get_position()[1]):
1151            return True
1152        return False
1153
1154    def unvisit_all_checkpoints(self):
1155        """
1156        This function iterates over the tasks of this robot and 
1157        marks all the checkpoints assigned to the tasks as not visited.
1158        """
1159        for task in self._tasks:
1160            task.unvisit_all_checkpoints()

1164    def ros_spin_once(self):
1165        """
1166        Spin the ROS2-node once (every robot is also a ROS2-node) to process the data sent through ROS2-interfaces
1167        """
1168        rclpy.spin_once(self, timeout_sec=0)
1169
1170    def ros_publish_message_info(self, msg_id, time_step):
1171        """
1172        This function generates a ROS2 message of type [mapf_interfaces/RobotInfo.msg] 
1173        and publishes it to the following topic: */mapf_robot_info_"ID"*
1174        
1175        This function will be called by the model every time a robot performs an action and then has to publish
1176        the updated information about itself.
1177
1178        :param msg_id:      int  -   The id of the current cycle (sim->controller->planner->controller->sim)
1179        :param time_step:   int  -   Sets the time step in the published message (msg.step = time_step)
1180        """
1181
1182        msg  = RobotInfo()
1183        pos  = Position()
1184        checkpoint_msg = CheckpointInfo()
1185        goal = Position()
1186        
1187        #Add CYCLE-ID        
1188        msg.id = msg_id
1189        #Add STEP        
1190        msg.step = time_step
1191        #Add ROBOT_ID
1192        msg.robot_id = int(self.get_id())
1193        #Add BUCKET
1194        msg.bucket = int(self.get_bucket())
1195        #Add OPTIMAL_LENGTH
1196        msg.optimal_length = float(self.get_heuristic())
1197        #Add POSITION
1198        pos.pos_x, pos.pos_y, pos.theta = self.get_position()
1199        msg.position = pos
1200
1201        #Add CHECKPOINTS
1202        task = self.get_task(index =0)
1203        checkpoints = task.get_checkpoints()
1204        for checkpoint, name in checkpoints:    
1205            checkpoint_msg.position.pos_x, checkpoint_msg.position.pos_y = checkpoint.get_position()
1206            checkpoint_msg.position.theta = 0.0
1207            checkpoint_msg.visited = checkpoint.get_visit_status()
1208            msg.checkpoints.append(checkpoint_msg)
1209
1210        #publish message: RobotInfo.msg
1211        self.publisher.publish(msg)
1212        return
1213
1214    #TODO: check action = move or action = rotate
1215    def callback_action(self, msg):
1216        """
1217        This function will be called every time a message on the following topics is received: 
1218        */mapf_robot_info_"ID"*
1219
1220        This function creates an action from the received message and 
1221        saves the action in the robot for the (in the message) defined step!
1222        
1223        :param msg: mapf_interfaces/RobotAction.msg - message from the topic /mapf_robot_action_ID
1224        """
1225
1226        print("Message received")
1227        print("STEP: %d" % msg.step)
1228        print("robot_id: %d"  % msg.robot_id)
1229        print("move x: %d"  % msg.move_x)
1230        print("move y: %d"  % msg.move_y)
1231        print("rotate: %d" % msg.rotate)
1232        
1233        #skip message if action not for current step
1234        if msg.step != self._model.get_current_step():
1235            print("SKIP MESSAGE, WRONG STEP")
1236            print("Robot ID: " + str(msg.robot_id))
1237            print("Msg step: " + str(msg.step))
1238            print("Current step: " + str(self._model.get_current_step()))
1239            return
1240        
1241        action = Action(msg.move_x, msg.move_y, 'move')
1242        self.set_action(action, msg.step)
1243        self.set_future_path(msg.path)
1244        self.set_ready(True)

1247class CheckpointROS(VisualizerGraphicItem):
1248    """
1249    This class represents a Checkpoint.
1250
1251    **Attributes**:
1252    -   **_kind_name**:     str                 -   The name of this kind of item. This is always 'checkpoint_ros'.
1253    -   **_graphics_item**: QGraphicsRectItem   -   This is the main graphic item of the checkpoint
1254                                                    and is used for some default functions.
1255    -   **_text**:          QGraphicsTextItem   -   This is a text item that is drawn on the model view
1256                                                    and represents primarily the id of the checkpoint.
1257    -   **_shine**:         bool                -   This is true if the checkpoint should be highlighted. Checkpoints
1258    """
1259
1260    def __init__(self, ID = 0, x = 0, y = 0, theta = 0.0):
1261        """
1262        :param ID:      int, optional    - The ID of the item
1263        :param x:       int, optional    - The x coordinate on the grid
1264        :param y:       int, optional    - The y coordinate on the grid
1265        :param theta:   int, optional    - Orientation of the item (not used currently)
1266        """
1267        super(self.__class__, self).__init__(ID, x, y)
1268        self._kind_name = 'checkpoint_ros'
1269        self.set_position(x,y)
1270        self.set_starting_position(x,y)
1271
1272        #self._graphics_item = QGraphicsEllipseItem(self)
1273        self._graphics_item = QGraphicsRectItem(self)
1274        self._text = QGraphicsTextItem(self._graphics_item)
1275        self._pen = QPen()
1276        self.setZValue(1.0)
1277
1278        self._shine = False
1279        self._visited = False
1280        #self._checkpoint_number = 0
1281

1285        """
1286        Returns the current rectangle of an item.
1287

1289        """

1302    def determine_color(self, number, count, pattern = None):
1303        """
1304        Determines the color of the checkpoint.
1305        
1306        :param number: int  -   The number of this item in the models sequence. 
1307                                This does not necessarily have to be the ID of the item.
1308        :param count: int   -   The maximal count of all items in the model of this kind.
1309        :param pattern: int -   Not used.
1310        """
1311        color = calculate_color(self._colors[0], self._colors[1], (float)(number)/count)
1312        #color = QColor(255,255,255) #white
1313        self._color = color
1314        
1315        #if self._shine:
1316        #    color = QColor(51,255,0)
1317        self._graphics_item.setBrush(QBrush(color))
1318
1319    def set_rect(self, rect):
1320        """    
1321        Sets the rectangle that a checkpoint can use to draw things in.
1322        This equals one field of the grid in the model view.
1323        This function defines the appearance of the checkpoint
1324        on the grid.
1325
1326        :param rect: QtCore.QRect   - The rectangle that a checkpoint can use to draw things in.
1327        """
1328        scale = config.get('display', 'id_font_scale')
1329        bold = config.get('display', 'id_font_bold')
1330        
1331        #SET FONTSIZE, TEXT POSITION AND DEFAULT TEXT COLOR
1332        self._text.setFont(QFont('', rect.width()*0.3*scale))
1333        self._text.setPos(rect.x(), rect.y() + 0.1*rect.height())
1334        self._text.setDefaultTextColor(QColor(config.get('display', 'id_font_color')))
1335
1336        #SET DISPLAY MODE
1337        if self._display_mode == 0:
1338            if bold:
1339                self._text.setHtml('<b>' + str(self._id) + '</b>')
1340            else:
1341                self._text.setHtml(str(self._id))
1342        else:
1343            self._text.setPlainText('')
1344
1345        #SET POSITION AND SIZE OF GRAPHICS ITEM INSIDE THE CELL 
1346        rect2 = QRectF()
1347        rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.05*rect.width(), 
1348                            rect.y() + 0.05*rect.height(),
1349                            rect.width()*0.9,
1350                            rect.height()*0.9)
1351
1352        self._pen.setColor(QColor(255, 0, 0, 255))
1353        self._pen.setWidth(rect.width()*0.1)
1354
1355        #IF HIGHLIGHTED
1356        if self._highlighted:        
1357            rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.0*rect.width(), 
1358                            rect.y() + 0.0*rect.height(),
1359                            rect.width()*1.0,
1360                            rect.height()*1.0)
1361            self._pen.setColor(QColor(0, 0, 255, 255))
1362            self._pen.setWidth(rect.width()*0.2)
1363
1364        #IF SHINE
1365        if self._shine:    
1366            self._pen.setColor(QColor(0, 255, 0, 255))
1367        
1368        #SAVE 
1369        self._graphics_item.setRect(rect2)        
1370        self._graphics_item.setPen(self._pen)

1384        """

1412    def to_occurs_str(self):
1413        """
1414        This function returns a list of strings that represents all
1415        actions of an item.        
1416        """
1417
1418        actions = []
1419        count = 0
1420        for action in self._actions:
1421            if action is None:
1422                actions.append(None)
1423            else:
1424                actions.append('occurs(object('
1425                    + self._kind_name + ', '
1426                    + str(self._id) + '), '
1427                    + str(action) + ', '
1428                    + str(count) + ').\n')
1429            count = count + 1
1430        return actions
1431
1432    def parse_init_value(self, name, value):
1433        """
1434        This function handels the input phrases for every item.
1435        This is called for every phrase the model receives with the
1436        following syntax: 
1437        init(object([object type], [object ID]), value([value name], [value])).
1438        While [object type] is the same as self._kind_name and [object ID]
1439        is the ID of the object and is the same as self._id.
1440        The model decides based on this value the object that receives
1441        the phrase.
1442
1443        Parameters:
1444        name: str
1445            This is the name of the value.
1446        value: clingo.symbol.Symbol
1447            This is the actual value. It contains the [value]
1448            part of the phrase.        
1449
1450        Returns 1 if the phrase cannot be parsed, -1 if one parameter is
1451        invalid and 0 if the function succeeded.
1452        """
1453
1454        if value is None or name is None:
1455            return -1
1456        if name == 'at':
1457            pos = (value.arguments[0].number, value.arguments[1].number)
1458            self.set_starting_position(pos[0], pos[1])
1459            self.set_position(pos[0], pos[1])
1460            return 0
1461        return 1
1462
1463    def to_init_str(self):
1464        """
1465        Converts the item to a string that represents the items values.
1466        This function is used to send the whole model to a solver
1467        and to save an instance to a file.
1468        """
1469
1470        return ('init(object('
1471                + self._kind_name + ','
1472                + str(self._id) + '), value(at,('
1473                + str(self._position[0]) + ','
1474                + str(self._position[1]) + '))).')
1475

1514    def parse_init_value(self, name, value):
1515        """
1516        This function handels the input phrases for robots.
1517        This is called for every phrase the model receives with the
1518        following syntax: 
1519        init(object(robot, [robot ID]), value([value name], [value])).
1520
1521        Parameters:
1522        name: str
1523            This is the name of the value.
1524        value: clingo.symbol.Symbol
1525            This is the actual value. It contains the [value]
1526            part of the phrase.        
1527
1528        Returns 1 if the phrase cannot be parsed, -1 if one parameter is
1529        invalid and 0 if the function succeeded.   
1530        """
1531
1532        result = super(self.__class__, self).parse_init_value(name, value)
1533        if result <= 0: return result
1534        if name == 'carries':
1535            shelf = self._model.get_item('shelf', value, True, True)
1536            self.set_initial_carries(shelf)
1537            self.set_carries(shelf)
1538            return 0
1539        elif name == 'energy':
1540            self.set_current_energy(value.number)
1541            self.set_initial_energy(value.number)
1542            return 0
1543        elif name == 'max_energy':
1544            self.set_max_energy(value.number)
1545            return 0
1546        elif name == 'energy_cost':
1547            self._energy_costs[value.arguments[0].name] = value.arguments[1].number
1548            return 0
1549        return 1
1550
1551    def to_init_str(self):
1552        """
1553        Converts the robot to a string that represents the robots values.
1554        This function is used to send robots to a solver
1555        and to save robots to a file.
1556        """
1557
1558        s = super(self.__class__, self).to_init_str()
1559        if self._initial_carries is not None:
1560            s += ("init(object(robot,"
1561                    + str(self._id) + "),value(carries,"
1562                    + str(self._initial_carries.get_id())
1563                    + ")).")
1564        s += ("init(object(robot," 
1565                + str(self._id) + "), value(max_energy,"
1566                + str(self._max_energy)
1567                + ")).")
1568        s += ("init(object(robot," 
1569                + str(self._id) + "), value(energy,"
1570                + str(self._current_energy)
1571                + ")).")
1572        for key in self._energy_costs:
1573            s += ("init(object(robot,"
1574                    + str(self._id) + "),value(energy_cost, ("
1575                    + key + ", " + str(self._energy_costs[key]) + "))).")
1576        return s
1577
1578    def to_occurs_str(self):
1579        """
1580        This function returns a list of strings that represents all
1581        actions of a robot.        
1582        """
1583
1584        actions = []
1585        count = 0
1586        for action in self._actions:
1587            str_out = ''
1588            if action is None:
1589                actions.append(None)
1590            else:
1591                str_out = ''
1592                if action is not None:
1593                    str_out = ('occurs(object('
1594                        + self._kind_name + ', '
1595                        + str(self._id) + '), '
1596                        + str(action) + ', '
1597                        + str(count) + ').\n')
1598                actions.append(str_out)
1599            count = count + 1
1600        return actions

1646        following syntax: 
1647        init(object(checkpoint, [checkpoint ID]), value([value name], [value])).
1648
1649        Parameters:
1650        name: str

1654            part of the phrase.

1657        invalid and 0 if the function succeeded.   
1658        """
1659

1662            return result
1663

1665            if str(value.arguments[0]) not in self._ids:
1666                self._ids[str(value.arguments[0])] = []
1667            self._ids[str(value.arguments[0])].append((str(value.arguments[1]), value.arguments[2].number))
1668            return 0
1669        return 1

1673class Shelf(VisualizerGraphicItem):
1674    """
1675    This class represents a shelf.
1676
1677    Attributes:
1678    _kind_name: str
1679        The name of this kind of item. This is always 'shelf'.
1680    _carried: Robot
1681        The robot that carries this shelf.
1682    _products: list
1683        This is a list of products. Every product is a triple.
1684        (product id, product amount, removed product amount)
1685    _graphics_item: QGraphicsEllipseItem
1686        This is the main graphic item of the shelf
1687        and is used for some default functions.
1688    _graphics_carried: QGraphicsEllipseItem
1689        This is a circle appearing on a carried shelf.
1690    _text: QGraphicsTextItem
1691        This is a text item that is drawn 
1692        on the model view and represents primarily the id of the shelf.
1693    """
1694
1695    def __init__(self, ID = 0, x = 0, y = 0):
1696        """
1697        Parameters:
1698        ID : int, optional
1699            The ID of the shelf
1700        x: int, optional
1701            The x coordinate on the grid
1702        y: int, optional
1703            The y coordinate on the grid
1704        """
1705
1706        super(self.__class__, self).__init__(ID, x, y)
1707        self._kind_name = 'shelf'
1708        self._carried = None
1709        self._products   = []
1710        self._graphics_item = QGraphicsEllipseItem(self)
1711        self._graphics_carried = QGraphicsEllipseItem()
1712        self._text = QGraphicsTextItem(self)
1713        self.setZValue(2.0)
1714        self.update_tooltip()
1715
1716    def set_rect(self, rect):
1717        """
1718        Sets the rectangle that a shelf can use to draw things in.
1719        This equals one field of the grid in the model view.
1720        This function defines the appearance of the shelf
1721        on the grid.
1722        """
1723
1724        if self._carried is not None:
1725            rect = self._carried.get_rect()
1726
1727        scale = config.get('display', 'id_font_scale')
1728        bold = config.get('display', 'id_font_bold')
1729        self._text.setFont(QFont('', rect.width()*0.08*scale))
1730        self._text.setPos(rect.x(), rect.y() + 0.4*rect.height())
1731        self._text.setDefaultTextColor(
1732            QColor(config.get('display', 'id_font_color')))
1733
1734        if self._display_mode == 0:
1735            if bold:
1736                self._text.setHtml('<b>S(' + str(self._id) + ')</b>')
1737            else:
1738                self._text.setHtml('S(' + str(self._id) + ')')
1739            self._graphics_item.setRect(rect.x() + 0.25*rect.width(), 
1740                                        rect.y() + 0.25*rect.height(),
1741                                        rect.width()*0.5,
1742                                        rect.height()*0.5)
1743
1744            self._graphics_carried.setRect(rect.x() + 0.325*rect.width(), 
1745                                        rect.y() + 0.325*rect.height(),
1746                                        rect.width()*0.35,
1747                                        rect.height()*0.35)
1748        elif self._display_mode == 1:
1749            self._text.setPlainText('')
1750            self._graphics_item.setRect(rect.x() + 0.05*rect.width(),
1751                                        rect.y() + 0.05*rect.height(),
1752                                        rect.width()*0.9,
1753                                        rect.height()*0.9)
1754            self._graphics_carried.setRect(rect.x() + 0.125*rect.width(),
1755                                        rect.y() + 0.125*rect.height(),
1756                                        rect.width()*0.75,
1757                                        rect.height()*0.75)
1758
1759
1760    def set_carried(self, robot):
1761        """
1762        Sets the robot that carries this shelf at the current time step.
1763        Sets also the shelf that is carried by the robot to this.
1764        If the shelf is already carried by another robot the carried 
1765        shelf of this robot will be set to None.
1766        """
1767
1768        #Checks if the shelf is already carried by the robot 
1769        #to prevent an infinite loop.
1770        if robot == self._carried:
1771            return
1772        temp = self._carried
1773        self._carried = robot
1774        if temp is not None:
1775            temp.set_carries(None)
1776        if self._carried is not None:
1777            self._graphics_carried.setParentItem(self._graphics_item)
1778            self._carried.set_carries(self)
1779        else:
1780            self._graphics_carried.setParentItem(None)
1781
1782    def restart(self):
1783        """
1784        Reset the products in the shelf.
1785        Sets the shelf to its starting position.
1786        """
1787
1788        super(self.__class__, self).restart()
1789        products = []
1790        for product in self._products:
1791            products.append((product[0], product[1], 0))
1792        self._products = products
1793
1794    def to_init_str(self):
1795        """
1796        Converts the shelf to a string that represents the shelfs values.
1797        This function is used to send shelves to a solver
1798        and to save shelves to a file.
1799        """
1800
1801        s = super(self.__class__, self).to_init_str()
1802        for product in self._products:
1803            s += ('init(object(product,' 
1804                    + str(product[0]) + '),value(on,('
1805                    + str(self._id) + ',' 
1806                    + str(product[1]) + '))).')
1807        return s
1808
1809    def update_tooltip(self):
1810        """
1811        Updates the tooltip for the shelf.
1812        """
1813
1814        tooltip = "shelf(" + str(self._id) + ")\nproducts:\n"
1815        for product in self._products:
1816            tooltip = tooltip + str(product) + "\n"
1817        self.setToolTip(tooltip)
1818
1819    def find_product(self, product_id):
1820        """
1821        Returns a product with the given product id.
1822        If no product with the given id is on the shelf it returns None.
1823        """
1824
1825        for product in self._products:
1826            if str(product_id) == str(product[0]):
1827                return product
1828        return None
1829
1830
1831    def set_product_amount(self, product_id, amount):
1832        """
1833        Sets the carried amount of a product on this shelf.
1834        If the shelf already contains products with the 
1835        given id the amount of products will be overriden.
1836        """
1837
1838        product = self.find_product(product_id)
1839        if product is None:
1840            self._products.append((product_id, amount, 0))
1841        else:
1842            self._products.remove(product)
1843            self._products.append((product_id, amount, product[2]))
1844        self.update_tooltip()
1845
1846    def add_product(self, product_id, amount):
1847        """
1848        Adds to the carried amount of a product on this shelf.
1849        If amount is 0 and the shelf already contains products
1850        with the given amount it will be set to 0.
1851        """
1852
1853        product = self.find_product(product_id)
1854        if product is None:
1855            self._products.append((product_id, amount, 0))
1856        else: 
1857            if amount == 0:
1858                self._products.append((product_id, 0, 0))
1859            else:
1860                self._products.append((product_id, product[1] + amount, 0))
1861            self._products.remove(product)
1862        self.update_tooltip()
1863
1864    def remove_product(self, product_id, amount):
1865        """
1866        Increases the removed amount counter of a product on the shelf.
1867        If the shelf does not contain a product with the 
1868        given id nothing happens.
1869        """
1870
1871        product = self.find_product(product_id)
1872        if product is not None:
1873            self._products.append((product_id, product[1], product[2] + amount))
1874            self._products.remove(product)
1875
1876    def delete_product(self, product_id):
1877        """
1878        Deletes a product from a shelf.
1879        If the shelf does not contain a product with the 
1880        given id nothing happens.
1881        """
1882
1883        product = self.find_product(product_id)
1884        if product is not None:
1885            self._products.remove(product)
1886        self.update_tooltip()
1887
1888    def determine_color(self, number, count, pattern = None):
1889        """
1890        Determines the color of the picking station.
1891        """
1892        
1893        color = calculate_color(self._colors[0], self._colors[1], (float)(number)/count)
1894        brush = QBrush(color)
1895        self._graphics_item.setBrush(brush)
1896        self._graphics_carried.setBrush(QBrush(self._colors[2]))
1897
1898    def get_product_amount(self, product_id):
1899        """
1900        Returns the current amount of a specific product on a shelf.
1901        """
1902
1903        product = self.find_product(product_id)
1904        if product is None:
1905            return 0
1906        return product[1] - product[2]
1907
1908    def get_rect(self):
1909        """
1910        Returns the current rectangle of the shelf.
1911        """
1912
1913        if self._display_mode == 0:
1914            rect = self._graphics_item.rect()
1915            width = rect.width()*2
1916            height = rect.height()*2
1917            rect.setLeft(rect.x() - 0.25*width)
1918            rect.setTop(rect.y() - 0.25*height)
1919            rect.setWidth(width)
1920            rect.setHeight(height)
1921            return rect
1922        elif self._display_mode == 1:
1923            rect = self._graphics_item.rect()
1924            width = rect.width()/0.9
1925            height = rect.height()/0.9
1926            rect.setLeft(rect.x() - 0.05*width)
1927            rect.setTop(rect.y() - 0.05*height)
1928            rect.setWidth(width)
1929            rect.setHeight(height)
1930            return rect
1931
1932
1933    def get_carried(self):
1934        """
1935        Returns the robot that carries the shelf at the current 
1936        time step. This can be None.
1937        """
1938
1939        return self._carried
1940
1941    def iterate_products(self):
1942        """
1943        Iterates through every product on the shelf.
1944        """
1945
1946        for product in self._products:
1947            yield product
1948
1949    def edit_position_to(self, x, y):
1950        """
1951        Sets a new starting position and new current position for the 
1952        shelf. If another shelf is already on the same position
1953        they swap positions. This function is used to edit instances with
1954        the drag and drop feature. Only shelf that are currently not carried 
1955        can be moved.        
1956        """
1957
1958        if (x, y) == self._position:
1959            return
1960        if self._carried is not None:
1961            return
1962        item2 = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = self._kind_name,
1963                                        position = (x,y),
1964                                        return_first = True)[0]
1965        if item2 is not None:
1966            if item2.get_carried() is not None:
1967                return
1968            item2.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
1969            item2.set_starting_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
1970        self.set_position(x,y)
1971        self.set_starting_position(x, y)
1972
1973    def mousePressEvent(self, event):
1974        """
1975        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
1976        """
1977
1978        if self._carried is not None:
1979            self._carried.mousePressEvent(event)
1980        else:
1981            super(self.__class__, self).mousePressEvent(event)
1982
1983    def mouseMoveEvent(self, event):
1984        """
1985        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
1986        """
1987
1988        if self._carried is not None:
1989            self._carried.mouseMoveEvent(event)
1990        else:
1991            super(self.__class__, self).mouseMoveEvent(event)
1992
1993    def mouseReleaseEvent(self, event):
1994        """
1995        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
1996        """
1997
1998        if self._carried is not None:
1999            self._carried.mouseReleaseEvent(event)
2000        else:
2001            super(self.__class__, self).mouseReleaseEvent(event)

2005class Checkpoint(VisualizerGraphicItem):
2006    """
2007    This class represents a Checkpoint.
2008
2009    Attributes:
2010    _kind_name: str
2011        The name of this kind of item. This is always 'checkpoint'.
2012    _ids: dictionary
2013        A dictionary that contains all ids of this checkpoint.
2014        One checkpoint can be the destination of different kinds
2015        of waypoints like a goal and start node.
2016    _graphics_item: QGraphicsRectItem
2017        This is the main graphic item of the checkpoint
2018        and is used for some default functions.
2019    _text: QGraphicsTextItem
2020        This is a text item that is drawn on the model view
2021        and represents primarily the id of the checkpoint.
2022    _shine: bool
2023        This is true if the checkpoint should be highlighted. Checkpoints
2024        are highlighted when they were visited.
2025    """
2026
2027    def __init__(self, ID = 0, x = 0, y = 0):
2028        super(self.__class__, self).__init__(ID, x, y)
2029        self._kind_name = 'checkpoint'
2030
2031        self._ids = {}
2032
2033        self._graphics_item = QGraphicsRectItem(self)
2034        self._text = QGraphicsTextItem(self._graphics_item)
2035        self._shine = False
2036
2037    def set_rect(self, rect):
2038        """    
2039        Sets the rectangle that a checkpoint can use to draw things in.
2040        This equals one field of the grid in the model view.
2041        This function defines the appearance of the checkpoint
2042        on the grid.
2043        """
2044
2045        scale = config.get('display', 'id_font_scale')
2046        bold = config.get('display', 'id_font_bold')
2047        font = QFont('', rect.width()*0.08*scale)
2048        self._text.setFont(font)
2049        self._text.setPos(rect.x(), rect.y() + 0.6*rect.height())
2050        self._text.setDefaultTextColor(QColor(config.get('display', 'id_font_color')))
2051
2052        if self._display_mode == 0:            
2053            ss = ''
2054            if bold:
2055                ss = '<b>'
2056            for key in self._ids:
2057                count = 0
2058                for ii in self._ids[key]:
2059                    if count == 0:
2060                        ss = ss + '(' + key + ': ' + ii[0]
2061                    else:
2062                        ss = ss + ', ' + ii[0]
2063                    count += 1
2064                ss = ss + ')\n'
2065
2066            if bold:
2067                ss += '</b>'
2068
2069            self._text.setHtml(ss)
2070            self._graphics_item.setRect(rect.x(), rect.y(), rect.width(), rect.height())
2071
2072        elif self._display_mode == 1:
2073            self._text.setPlainText('')
2074            self._graphics_item.setRect(rect.x(), rect.y(), rect.width(), rect.height())        
2075
2076    def do_action(self, time_step):
2077        """
2078        Rests the shine value at every time step.
2079        """
2080
2081        self._shine = False
2082        return
2083
2084    def undo_action(self, time_step):
2085        """
2086        Rests the shine value at every time step.
2087        """
2088
2089        self._shine = False
2090        return
2091
2092    def visit(self):
2093        """
2094        Sets the shine value to true.
2095        """    
2096
2097        self._shine = True
2098
2099    def determine_color(self, number, count, pattern = None):
2100        """
2101        Determines the color of the checkpoint.
2102        """
2103
2104        color = None
2105        if len(self._ids) == 1:
2106            for key in self._ids:
2107                color_id = self._ids[key][0][1] + 1
2108                if color_id < len(self._colors):
2109                    color = self._colors[color_id]    
2110                        
2111        if color is None:
2112            color = self._colors[0]
2113
2114        if self._shine:
2115            color = calculate_color(color, QColor(255,255,255), 0.4)
2116        self._graphics_item.setBrush(QBrush(color))
2117
2118    def parse_init_value(self, name, value):
2119        """
2120        This function handels the input phrases for checkpoints.
2121        This is called for every phrase the model receives with the
2122        following syntax: 
2123        init(object(checkpoint, [checkpoint ID]), value([value name], [value])).
2124
2125        Parameters:
2126        name: str
2127            This is the name of the value.
2128        value: clingo.symbol.Symbol
2129            This is the actual value. It contains the [value]
2130            part of the phrase.
2131
2132        Returns 1 if the phrase cannot be parsed, -1 if one parameter is
2133        invalid and 0 if the function succeeded.   
2134        """
2135
2136        result = super(self.__class__, self).parse_init_value(name, value)
2137        if result != 1:
2138            return result
2139
2140        if name == 'checkpoint' and len(value.arguments) == 3:
2141            if str(value.arguments[0]) not in self._ids:
2142                self._ids[str(value.arguments[0])] = []
2143            self._ids[str(value.arguments[0])].append((str(value.arguments[1]), value.arguments[2].number))
2144            return 0
2145        return 1
2146
2147    def get_rect(self):
2148        """
2149        Returns the current rectangle of the checkpoint.
2150        """
2151
2152        return self._graphics_item.rect()

2156class Robot(VisualizerGraphicItem):
2157    """
2158    This class represents a robot.
2159
2160    Attributes:
2161    _kind_name: str
2162        The name of this kind of item. This is always 'robot'.
2163    _carried: Shelf
2164        The shelf that is carried by the robot.
2165    _initial_carries: Shelf
2166        The shelf that is carried by the robot at time step 0.
2167    _tasks: list
2168        The list of tasks of the robot
2169    _graphics_item: QGraphicsRectItem
2170        This is the main graphic item of the robot
2171        and is used for some default functions.
2172    _energy_bar_full: QGraphicsRectItem
2173        This graphic item represents a full energy bar.
2174    _energy_bar_empty: QGraphicsRectItem
2175        This graphic item represents a empty energy bar.
2176    _text: QGraphicsTextItem
2177        This is a text item that is drawn 
2178        on the model view and represents primarily the id of the robot.
2179    _initial_energy: int
2180        The robots energy at time step 0.
2181    _max_energy: int
2182        The robots maximal energy
2183    _current_energy: int
2184        The current energy of the robot
2185    _energy_costs: dictionary
2186        A dictionary that contains energy costs for actions.
2187        The cost should be an integer. The dictionary keys
2188        are the name of the actions.
2189    _parallel_delivers: dictionary
2190        A dictionary that contains deliver actions that are 
2191        processed simultaneously to other actions. The deliver actions
2192        are stored in lists to allow multiple deliveries at the same time
2193        step.

2196    def __init__(self, ID = 0, x = 0, y = 0):
2197        """

2199        ID : int, optional
2200            The ID of the robot
2201        x: int, optional
2202            The x coordinate on the grid
2203        y: int, optional
2204            The y coordinate on the grid
2205        """
2206
2207        super(self.__class__, self).__init__(ID, x, y)
2208        self._kind_name = 'robot'
2209        self._carries = None
2210        self._initial_carries = None
2211        self._tasks = []
2212        self._graphics_item = QGraphicsRectItem(self)
2213        self._energy_bar_full = QGraphicsRectItem(self)
2214        self._energy_bar_empty = QGraphicsRectItem(self)
2215        self._text = QGraphicsTextItem(self)
2216        self.setZValue(1.0)
2217
2218        self._energy_bar_empty.setBrush(QBrush(QColor(200,0,0)))
2219        self._energy_bar_full.setBrush(QBrush(QColor(0,200,0)))
2220
2221        self._initial_energy = 0
2222        self._max_energy = 0
2223        self._current_energy = 0
2224        self._energy_costs = {}
2225
2226        self._parallel_delivers = {}
2227
2228    def set_position(self, x, y):
2229        """
2230        Sets the current position of the robot.
2231        Sets also the current position of a carried shelf to the same position.
2232        """
2233        super(self.__class__, self).set_position(x, y)
2234        if self._carries is not None:
2235           self._carries.set_position(x, y)

2239        """
2240        Sets the starting position of the robot.
2241        Sets also the starting position of a carried shelf to the same position.
2242        """

2245        if self._initial_carries is not None:
2246           self._initial_carries.set_starting_position(x, y)

2248    def set_carries(self, shelf):
2249        """
2250        Sets the shelf that is carried by this robot the at current time step.
2251        Sets also the robot that carries the given shelf.
2252        If the robot already carries another shelf the other shelves 
2253        carried value will be set to None.
2254        """
2255
2256        #Checks whether the shelf is already carried by the robot 
2257        #to prevent a infinite loop.
2258        if shelf == self._carries:
2259            return
2260        old = self._carries
2261        self._carries = shelf
2262        if old != None: old.set_carried(None)
2263        if self._carries != None: self._carries.set_carried(self)
2264
2265    def set_initial_carries(self, shelf):
2266        """
2267        Sets a shelf that is carried at the begin.
2268        """
2269        self._initial_carries = shelf
