2271    def set_rect(self, rect):
2272        """    
2273        Sets the rectangle that a robot can use to draw things in.
2274        This equals one field of the grid in the model view.
2275        This function defines the appearance of the robot
2276        on the grid.
2277        """
2278
2279        scale = config.get('display', 'id_font_scale')
2280        bold = config.get('display', 'id_font_bold')
2281        self._text.setFont(QFont('', rect.width()*0.08*scale))
2282        self._text.setPos(rect.x(), rect.y() + 0.2*rect.height())
2283        self._text.setDefaultTextColor(QColor(config.get('display', 'id_font_color')))
2284        rect2 = QRectF()
2285
2286        if self._display_mode == 0:
2287            if bold:
2288                self._text.setHtml('<b>R(' + str(self._id) + ')</b>')
2289            else:
2290                self._text.setHtml('R(' + str(self._id) + ')')
2291            if not self._highlighted:
2292                rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.25*rect.width(), 
2293                               rect.y() + 0.25*rect.height(),
2294                               rect.width()*0.5,
2295                               rect.height()*0.5)
2296            else:
2297                rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.05*rect.width(), 
2298                               rect.y() + 0.05*rect.height(),
2299                               rect.width()*0.9,
2300                               rect.height()*0.9,)
2301
2302        else:
2303            self._text.setPlainText('')
2304            if not self._highlighted:
2305                rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.05*rect.width(), 
2306                               rect.y() + 0.05*rect.height(),
2307                               rect.width()*0.9,
2308                               rect.height()*0.9)
2309            else:
2310                rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() - 0.15*rect.width(), 
2311                               rect.y() - 0.15*rect.height(),
2312                               rect.width()*1.3,
2313                               rect.height()*1.3,)
2314
2315        self._graphics_item.setRect(rect2)
2316        #draw energy bar if max energy > 0
2317        if self._max_energy > 0:
2318            per_energy = max(0.0, min(1.0, float(self._current_energy) / self._max_energy))
2319            rect2.setLeft(rect2.x() + rect2.width()*0.7)
2320            rect2.setWidth(rect2.width()*0.5)
2321
2322            self._energy_bar_empty.setRect(rect2.x(), 
2323                                           rect2.y(),
2324                                           rect2.width(),
2325                                           rect2.height() * (1.0 - per_energy))
2326            self._energy_bar_full.setRect(rect2.x(), 
2327                                          rect2.y() + rect2.height() * (1.0 - per_energy), 
2328                                          rect2.width(), 
2329                                          rect2.height() * per_energy)
2330
2331        if self._carries is not None:
2332            self._carries.set_rect(rect)
2333        self.update_tooltip()

2335    def set_initial_energy(self, energy):
2336        """
2337        Sets the initial energy of the robot.
2338        """
2339
2340        self._initial_energy = energy
2341
2342    def set_action(self, action, time_step):
2343        """
2344        Sets the action for the specific time step.
2345        Overrides existing actions at the time step but prints out
2346        a warning since this should never happen. Accepts deliver
2347        actions simultaneously to other actions.
2348
2349        Parameters:
2350        action: clingo.symbol.Symbol
2351            This is the action that will be performed.
2352        time_step: int
2353            This is the time step at which the action
2354        shold be performed.
2355        """
2356
2357        if time_step < 0:
2358            print(('Warning: invalid time step in occurs(object('
2359                    + str(self._kind_name) + ','
2360                    + str(self._ID) + '),' + str(action)
2361                    + ',' + str(time_step) + ')'))
2362            print('time step is less than 0')
2363            return
2364        for ii in range((time_step + 1) - len(self._actions)):
2365            self._actions.append(None)
2366
2367        action_name = action.arguments[0].name
2368
2369        if action_name == 'deliver' and time_step in self._parallel_delivers:
2370            deliver_list = self._parallel_delivers[time_step]
2371            deliver_list.append(action)
2372            return
2373
2374        elif self._actions[time_step] is not None:
2375
2376            action_name2 = self._actions[time_step].arguments[0].name
2377
2378            if action_name == 'deliver':
2379                if not ll_config.get('features', 'domainc'):
2380                    print(('Warning: for object(' + str(self._kind_name)
2381                        + ', ' + str(self._id)
2382                        + ') multiple actions are defined at time step '
2383                        + str(time_step)))
2384
2385                if not time_step in self._parallel_delivers:
2386                    self._parallel_delivers[time_step] = []
2387                self._parallel_delivers[time_step].append(action)
2388                if action_name2 == 'deliver':
2389                    self._parallel_delivers[time_step].append(
2390                        self._actions[time_step])
2391                    self._actions[time_step] = None
2392                return
2393
2394            elif action_name2 == 'deliver':
2395                if not ll_config.get('features', 'domainc'):
2396                    print(('Warning: for object(' + str(self._kind_name)
2397                        + ', ' + str(self._id)
2398                        + ') multiple actions are defined at time step '
2399                        + str(time_step)))
2400
2401                if not time_step in self._parallel_delivers:
2402                    self._parallel_delivers[time_step] = []
2403                self._parallel_delivers[time_step].append(
2404                    self._actions[time_step])
2405                self._actions[time_step] = action
2406                return
2407
2408            else:
2409                print(('Warning: for object(' + str(self._kind_name)
2410                    + ', ' + str(self._id)
2411                    + ') multiple actions are defined at time step '
2412                    + str(time_step)))
2413        self._actions[time_step] = action
2414
2415    def set_current_energy(self, energy):
2416        """
2417        Sets the current energy of the robot.
2418        """
2419
2420        self._current_energy = energy
2421
2422    def set_max_energy(self, energy):
2423        """
2424        Sets the maximal energy of the robot.
2425        """
2426
2427        self._max_energy = energy
2428
2429    def add_energy(self, energy):
2430        """
2431        Adds energy to or removes energy from the robot.
2432        """
2433
2434        self._current_energy = self._current_energy + energy
2435
2436    def add_task(self, task):
2437        """
2438        Adds a task to the robot.
2439        """
2440
2441        if task is None:
2442            return
2443        if task in self._tasks:
2444            return
2445        self._tasks.append(task)
2446        task.set_robot(self)
2447
2448    def parse_init_value(self, name, value):
2449        """
2450        This function handels the input phrases for robots.
2451        This is called for every phrase the model receives with the
2452        following syntax: 
2453        init(object(robot, [robot ID]), value([value name], [value])).
2454
2455        Parameters:
2456        name: str
2457            This is the name of the value.
2458        value: clingo.symbol.Symbol
2459            This is the actual value. It contains the [value]
2460            part of the phrase.        
2461
2462        Returns 1 if the phrase cannot be parsed, -1 if one parameter is
2463        invalid and 0 if the function succeeded.   
2464        """
2465
2466        result = super(self.__class__, self).parse_init_value(name, value)
2467        if result <= 0: return result
2468        if name == 'carries':
2469            shelf = self._model.get_item('shelf', value, True, True)
2470            self.set_initial_carries(shelf)
2471            self.set_carries(shelf)
2472            return 0
2473        elif name == 'energy':
2474            self.set_current_energy(value.number)
2475            self.set_initial_energy(value.number)
2476            return 0
2477        elif name == 'max_energy':
2478            self.set_max_energy(value.number)
2479            return 0
2480        elif name == 'energy_cost':
2481            self._energy_costs[value.arguments[0].name] = value.arguments[1].number
2482            return 0
2483        return 1
2484
2485    def update_tooltip(self):
2486        """
2487        Updates the tooltip for the robot.
2488        """
2489
2490        tooltip = ("robot(" + str(self._id) + ")\nenergy: " + 
2491                   str(self._current_energy) + "/" + 
2492                   str(self._max_energy))
2493        if self._max_energy > 0:
2494            tooltip += ("(" + 
2495                        str(float(self._current_energy)/self._max_energy*100.0) + 
2496                        "%)")
2497        
2498        self.setToolTip(tooltip)
2499
2500    def restart(self):
2501        """
2502        Resets the energy and the carried shelf of the robot.
2503        Sets the robot to its starting position.
2504        """
2505
2506        super(self.__class__, self).restart()
2507        self.set_carries(self._initial_carries)
2508        self.set_current_energy(self._initial_energy)
2509
2510    def clear_actions(self):
2511        """
2512        Deletes all actions for an object.
2513        """
2514
2515        self._actions = []
2516        self._parallel_delivers = {}
2517
2518    def to_init_str(self):
2519        """
2520        Converts the robot to a string that represents the robots values.
2521        This function is used to send robots to a solver
2522        and to save robots to a file.
2523        """
2524
2525        s = super(self.__class__, self).to_init_str()
2526        if self._initial_carries is not None:
2527            s += ("init(object(robot,"
2528                    + str(self._id) + "),value(carries,"
2529                    + str(self._initial_carries.get_id())
2530                    + ")).")
2531        s += ("init(object(robot," 
2532                + str(self._id) + "), value(max_energy,"
2533                + str(self._max_energy)
2534                + ")).")
2535        s += ("init(object(robot," 
2536                + str(self._id) + "), value(energy,"
2537                + str(self._current_energy)
2538                + ")).")
2539        for key in self._energy_costs:
2540            s += ("init(object(robot,"
2541                    + str(self._id) + "),value(energy_cost, ("
2542                    + key + ", " + str(self._energy_costs[key]) + "))).")
2543        return s
2544
2545    def to_occurs_str(self):
2546        """
2547        This function returns a list of strings that represents all
2548        actions of a robot.        
2549        """
2550
2551        actions = []
2552        count = 0
2553        for action in self._actions:
2554            str_out = ''
2555            if action is None and count not in self._parallel_delivers:
2556                actions.append(None)
2557            else:
2558                str_out = ''
2559                if action is not None:
2560                    str_out = ('occurs(object('
2561                        + self._kind_name + ', '
2562                        + str(self._id) + '), '
2563                        + str(action) + ', '
2564                        + str(count) + ').\n')
2565                if count in self._parallel_delivers:
2566                    for action2 in self._parallel_delivers[count]:
2567                        str_out += ('occurs(object('
2568                            + self._kind_name + ', '
2569                            + str(self._id) + '), '
2570                            + str(action2) + ', '
2571                            + str(count) + ').\n')
2572                actions.append(str_out)
2573            count = count + 1
2574        return actions
2575
2576    def _do_deliver(self, action, value, time_step):
2577        """
2578        Performs the given deliver action.
2579
2580        Parameters:
2581        action: clingo.symbol.Symbol
2582            This symbol contains the name of the action.
2583        value: clingo.symbol.Symbol
2584            This symbol contains the values of the
2585            deliver action.
2586        """
2587        #deliver with 3 arguments
2588        if len(value.arguments) > 2:
2589            try:
2590                if self._carries is not None:
2591                    self._carries.remove_product(value.arguments[1], value.arguments[2].number)
2592                order = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = 'order', 
2593                            ID = value.arguments[0], 
2594                            return_first = True)[0]
2595                if order is None:
2596                    return -2
2597                order.deliver(value.arguments[1], value.arguments[2].number, time_step)
2598                self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_DELIVERED
2599            except:
2600                return -3
2601            return 4
2602
2603        #deliver with 2 arguments
2604        elif len(value.arguments) > 1:
2605            try:
2606                if self._carries is not None:
2607                    self._carries.remove_product(value.arguments[1], 0)
2608                order = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = 'order', 
2609                            ID = value.arguments[0], 
2610                            return_first = True)[0]
2611                if order is None:
2612                    return -2
2613                order.deliver(value.arguments[1], 0, time_step)
2614                self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_DELIVERED
2615            except:
2616                return -3
2617            return 5
2618        return 0
2619
2620    def _undo_deliver(self, action, value, time_step):
2621        """
2622        Performs the given deliver action backwards.
2623
2624        Parameters:
2625        action: clingo.symbol.Symbol
2626            This symbol contains the name of the action.
2627        value: clingo.symbol.Symbol
2628            This symbol contains the values of the
2629            deliver action.
2630        """
2631
2632        #deliver with 3 arguments
2633        if len(value.arguments) > 2:
2634            try:
2635                if self._carries is not None:
2636                    self._carries.remove_product(value.arguments[1], -value.arguments[2].number)
2637                order = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = 'order', 
2638                            ID = value.arguments[0], 
2639                            return_first = True)[0]
2640                if order is None:
2641                    return -2
2642                order.deliver(value.arguments[1], -value.arguments[2].number, time_step)
2643                self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_DELIVERED
2644            except:
2645                return -3
2646            return 4
2647
2648        #deliver with 2 arguments
2649        elif len(value.arguments) > 1:
2650            try:
2651                if self._carries is not None:
2652                    self._carries.remove_product(value.arguments[1], 0)
2653                order = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = 'order', 
2654                            ID = value.arguments[0], 
2655                            return_first = True)[0]
2656                if order is None:
2657                    return -2
2658                order.deliver(value.arguments[1], 0, time_step)
2659                self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_DELIVERED
2660            except:
2661                return -3
2662            return 5
2663        return 0
2664
2665    def do_action(self, time_step):
2666        """
2667        Performs the actions of the robot.
2668        This function will be called every time the model does
2669        one time step forward.
2670        Returns 0 if no action was done.
2671        Returns a negative integer if an error occurred.
2672        Returns a positive integer if an action was done.
2673        """
2674
2675        self._state = self._state & ~VIZ_STATE_ACTION
2676
2677        #sets the state for the next action
2678        if time_step + 1 < len(self._actions):
2679            if self._actions[time_step + 1] is not None:
2680                action = self._actions[time_step + 1].arguments[0]
2681                if action.name == 'move':
2682                    self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVE
2683                elif action.name == 'deliver':
2684                    self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_DELIVER
2685                elif action.name == 'pickup':
2686                    self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_PICK_UP
2687                elif action.name == 'putdown':
2688                    self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_PUT_DOWN2
2689                elif action.name == 'charge':
2690                    self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_CHARGE
2691
2692
2693        if time_step >= len(self._actions):
2694            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
2695        if self._actions[time_step] is None:
2696            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
2697        if self._model is None:
2698            return -3
2699
2700        try:
2701            action = self._actions[time_step].arguments[0]
2702            value = self._actions[time_step].arguments[1]
2703        except:
2704            return -1
2705
2706        #energy cost
2707        if str(action.name) in self._energy_costs:
2708            try:
2709                self.add_energy(-self._energy_costs[action.name])
2710            except:
2711                print("Energy cost is not an integer.")
2712                self._energy_costs[action.name] = None
2713
2714        #do actions
2715        #do deliveries
2716        if time_step in self._parallel_delivers:
2717            for action2 in self._parallel_delivers[time_step]:
2718                self._do_deliver(
2719                    action2.arguments[0], 
2720                    action2.arguments[1], 
2721                    time_step)
2722
2723        #move
2724        if action.name == 'move':
2725            if len(value.arguments) != 2: 
2726                return -1
2727            try:
2728                move_x = value.arguments[0].number
2729                move_y = value.arguments[1].number
2730                self.set_position(self._position[0] + move_x, self._position[1] + move_y)
2731                self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVED
2732            except:
2733                self.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
2734
2735            for task in self._tasks:
2736                for checkpoint in task.get_checkpoints():
2737                    checkpoint = checkpoint[0]
2738                    pos = checkpoint.get_position()
2739                    if pos[0] == self._position[0] and pos[1] == self._position[1]:
2740                        task.visit_checkpoint(checkpoint)
2741                        break
2742            return 1
2743
2744        #pick up
2745        elif action.name == 'pickup':
2746            shelf = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = 'shelf',
2747                        position = self._position,
2748                        return_first = True)[0]
2749            if shelf is None:
2750                return -2
2751            self.set_carries(shelf)
2752            self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_PICKED_UP
2753            return 2
2754
2755        #put down
2756        elif action.name == 'putdown':
2757            if self._carries == None:
2758                return -2
2759            self.set_carries(None)
2760            self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_PUT_DOWN
2761            return 3
2762
2763        #deliver
2764        elif action.name == 'deliver':
2765            self._do_deliver(action, value, time_step)
2766            return 4
2767
2768        #charge
2769        elif action.name == 'charge':
2770            try:
2771                self.add_energy(value.number)
2772            except:
2773                return -4
2774            return 6
2775        return 0
2776
2777    def undo_action(self, time_step):
2778        """
2779        Performs the actions of the robot.
2780        This function will be called every time the model does
2781        one time step backwards.
2782        Returns 0 if no action was done.
2783        Returns a negative integer if an error occurred.
2784        Returns a positive integer if an action was done.
2785        """
2786
2787        self._state = self._state & ~VIZ_STATE_ACTION
2788        if time_step >= len(self._actions):  
2789            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
2790        if self._actions[time_step] == None: 
2791            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
2792        if self._model is None:
2793            return -3
2794
2795        try:
2796            action = self._actions[time_step].arguments[0]
2797            value = self._actions[time_step].arguments[1]
2798        except:
2799            return -1
2800
2801        #energy cost
2802        if action.name in self._energy_costs:
2803            try:
2804                self.add_energy(self._energy_costs[action.name])
2805            except:
2806                print("Energy cost is not an integer.")
2807                self._energy_costs[action.name] = None
2808
2809        #undo actions
2810        #undo deliveries
2811        if time_step in self._parallel_delivers:
2812            for action2 in self._parallel_delivers[time_step]:
2813                self._undo_deliver(
2814                    action2.arguments[0], 
2815                    action2.arguments[1], 
2816                    time_step)
2817
2818        #move
2819        if action.name == 'move':
2820            if len(value.arguments) != 2: 
2821                return -1
2822
2823            for task in self._tasks:
2824                for checkpoint in task.get_checkpoints():
2825                    checkpoint = checkpoint[0]
2826                    pos = checkpoint.get_position()
2827                    if pos[0] == self._position[0] and pos[1] == self._position[1]:
2828                        task.unvisit_checkpoint(checkpoint)
2829                        break
2830
2831            try:
2832                move_x = value.arguments[0].number
2833                move_y = value.arguments[1].number
2834                self.set_position(self._position[0] - move_x, self._position[1] - move_y)
2835                self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVE
2836            except:
2837                self.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
2838            if self._carries is not None: 
2839                self._carries.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
2840            return 1
2841
2842        #put down
2843        elif action.name == 'putdown':
2844            shelf = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = 'shelf',
2845                        position = self._position,
2846                        return_first = True)[0]
2847            if shelf is None:
2848                return -2
2849            self.set_carries(shelf)
2850            self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_PUT_DOWN2
2851            return 3
2852
2853        #pick up
2854        elif action.name == 'pickup':
2855            if self._carries == None:
2856                return -2
2857            self.set_carries(None)
2858            self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_PICK_UP
2859            return 2
2860
2861        #deliver
2862        elif action.name == 'deliver':
2863            self._undo_deliver(action, value, time_step)
2864            return 4
2865            
2866
2867        #charge
2868        elif action.name == 'charge':
2869            try:
2870                self.add_energy(-value.number)
2871            except:
2872                return -4
2873            return 6
2874        return 0
2875

2877    def determine_color(self, number, count, pattern = None):
2878        """
2879        Determines the color of the robot.
2880        """
2881
2882        color = calculate_color(self._colors[0], self._colors[1], (float)(number)/count)
2883        self._color = color
2884        brush = QBrush(color)
2885        self._graphics_item.setBrush(brush)

2887    def get_rect(self):
2888        """
2889        Returns the current rectangle of the robot.
2890        """
2891
2892        if self._display_mode == 0:
2893            rect = self._graphics_item.rect()
2894            width = rect.width()*2
2895            height = rect.height()*2
2896            rect.setLeft(rect.x() - 0.25*width)
2897            rect.setTop(rect.y() - 0.25*height)
2898            rect.setWidth(width)
2899            rect.setHeight(height)
2900            return rect
2901        elif self._display_mode == 1:
2902            rect = self._graphics_item.rect()
2903            width = rect.width()/0.9
2904            height = rect.height()/0.9
2905            rect.setLeft(rect.x() - 0.05*width)
2906            rect.setTop(rect.y() - 0.05*height)
2907            rect.setWidth(width)
2908            rect.setHeight(height)
2909            return rect
2910

2912        """
2913        Returns the shelf that is carried by this robot.
2914        This value can be None.

2917        return self._carries

2927    def edit_position_to(self, x, y):
2928        """
2929        Sets a new starting position and new current position for the 
2930        robot. If another robot is already on the same position
2931        they swap positions. This function is used to edit instances with
2932        the drag and drop feature. If on the destination node is a
2933        carried shelf or this robot carries a shelf and the destination
2934        node is occupied by another shelf the shelfs switch places as well.
2935        """
2936
2937        if (x, y) == self._position:
2938            return
2939        item2 = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = self._kind_name,
2940                                        position = (x,y),
2941                                        return_first = True)[0]
2942        shelf = self._model.filter_items('shelf',
2943                                        position = self._position,
2944                                        return_first = True)[0]
2945        shelf2 = self._model.filter_items('shelf',
2946                                        position = (x,y),
2947                                        return_first = True)[0]
2948
2949        if shelf2 is not None and shelf is not None:
2950            if shelf.get_carried() is not None or shelf2.get_carried() is not None:
2951                shelf.set_position(x,y)
2952                shelf.set_starting_position(x,y)
2953                shelf2.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
2954                shelf2.set_starting_position(self._position, self._position[1])
2955        if item2 is not None:
2956            item2.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
2957            item2.set_starting_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
2958        self.set_position(x,y)
2959        self.set_starting_position(x, y)
2960
2961    def get_current_energy(self):
2962        """
2963        Returns the current energy of the robot.
2964        """
2965
2966        return self._current_energy
2967
2968    def get_max_energy(self):
2969        """
2970        Returns the maximal energy of the robot.
2971        """
2972
2973        return self._max_energy

VIZ_STATE_MOVED = 1
VIZ_STATE_MOVE = 16
VIZ_STATE_ACTION = 65535
def calculate_color(first_color, second_color, multiplier): 
51def calculate_color(first_color, second_color, multiplier):
52    """
53    This function interpolates between two color values.
54
55    :return: QtGui.QColor()
56    """
57
58    red = (min(first_color.red(), second_color.red()), 
59            max(first_color.red(), second_color.red()))
60    green = (min(first_color.green(), second_color.green()), 
61            max(first_color.green(), second_color.green()))
62    blue = (min(first_color.blue(), second_color.blue()), 
63            max(first_color.blue(), second_color.blue()))
64    return QColor(
65                red[0] + (red[1] - red[0]) * multiplier,
66                green[0] + (green[1] - green[0]) * multiplier,
67                blue[0] + (blue[1] - blue[0]) * multiplier)

This function interpolates between two color values.

Returns

QtGui.QColor()

class VisualizerGraphicItem(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem, mapf_simulation.visualizerItem.VisualizerItem):

 72    This is the template class for visualizer graphic items.
 73    There should never be an instance of this class.
 74    A visualizer graphic item is a part of the visualizer model
 75    that is drawn on the model view and can perform actions.
 76
 77    **Attributes**:
 78    -   **_kind_name**: str         -   The name of this kind of object.
 79    -   **_ID**: int                -   The id of this object.
 80    -   **_model**: model.Model     -   The model this object belongs to

 86    -   **_enable_drag**: bool      -   This is true if drag and drop is enabled for this item.        
 87                                        This will be set by the model. 
 88    -   **_graphics_item**: QGraphicsItem - This is the main graphic item of this item

 92    -   **_actions**: list          -   This is a sorted list of the actions of this item. The index
 93                                        of every action is the time step at which the action occurs.

 95    -   **_colors**: list           -   A list of QColor values. Contains several colors for multi-colored

107    -   **_state**: int             -   Consists of one or more state flags, that describes which action

194    def set_action(self, action, time_step):
195        """
196        Sets the action for the specific time step.
197        Overrides existing actions at the time step but prints out
198        a warning since this should never happen.
199
200        :param action:      mapf_simulation.action.Action   -   This is the action that will be performed.
201        :param time_step:   int                             -   This is the time step at which the action should be performed.
202        """
203        if time_step < 0:
204            print(('Warning: invalid time step in occurs(object('
205                    + str(self._kind_name) + ','
206                    + str(self._id) + '),' + str(action)
207                    + ',' + str(time_step) + ')'))
208            print('time step is less than 0')
209            return
210        for ii in range((time_step + 1) - len(self._actions)):
211            self._actions.append(None)
212        if not self._actions[time_step] == None:
213            print(('Warning: for object(' + str(self._kind_name)
214                    + ', ' + str(self._id)
215                    + ') multiple actions are defined at time step '
216                    + str(time_step)))
217        self._actions[time_step] = action

317    def get_action(self, time_step):
318        """
319        Returns the action at a specific time step.
320        Returns None if no action is defined for this time step.
321
322        :param time_step:   int                      -   The time step for which the action should be returned.
323        :return: **mapf_simulation.action.Action**   -   The action at a specific time step.
324        """
325        if time_step >= len(self._actions):
326            return None  #break, if no action is defined
327        if self._actions[time_step] == None:
328            return None  #break, if no action is defined     
329        return self._actions[time_step]

380    #EVENTS
381    def mousePressEvent(self, event):
382        """
383        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
384        """
385        if self._enable_drag:
386            rect = self.get_rect()
387            self._dragged = (event.scenePos().x(),
388                             event.scenePos().y())
389        event.accept()
390
391    def mouseReleaseEvent(self, event):
392        """
393        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
394        """
395        model_view = None
396        if self._dragged is not None:
397            self._dragged = None
398            for view in self.scene().views():
399                if isinstance(view, mapf_simulation.modelView.ModelView):
400                    model_view = view
401        if model_view is None:
402            return
403        node = model_view.scene_coordinates_to_node(event.scenePos().x(),
404                                                    event.scenePos().y())
405        
406        self.setPos(0, 0)
407
408        if node is not None:
409            self.edit_position_to(node[0], node[1])
410        
411        model_view.update()
412        event.accept()
413
414    def mouseMoveEvent(self, event):
415        """
416        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
417        """
418        if self._dragged is None:
419            return
420        self.setPos(event.scenePos().x() - self._dragged[0], 
421                    event.scenePos().y() - self._dragged[1])
422        event.accept()
423

433        :param pattern: int -   Not used.

448        which can perform actions. This function will be called

457        """
458        Reverse action handler. Must be implemented for items
459        which can perform actions. This function will be called

461
462        :param time_step:   int     -   The time step for which the action should be reversed.

467    def clear_actions(self):
468        """
469        Deletes all actions for an object.
470        """
471
472        self._actions = []
473
474    def clear_older_actions(self, time_step):
475        """
476        Deletes all actions for the given time step (self._actions[time_step]) 
477        and after the given time step (self._actions[i>time_step]) for an object.
478        
479        :param time_step:   int -   Sets the steps (time>=time_step) for which the actions should be deleted.
480        """
481        if len(self._actions) == 0:
482            return
483        if len(self._actions)-1 < time_step:
484            return
485        if time_step == 0:
486            self._actions = []
487            return
488    
489        self._actions = self._actions[0:time_step]
490        return

495        Sets the items position to its starting position.

503        """

507    #MOVE / DRAG
508    def edit_position_to(self, x, y):
509        """
510        Sets a new starting position and new current position for an 
511        item. If an item of the same kind is already on the same position
512        they swap positions. This function is used to edit instances with
513        the drag and drop feature.
514        
515        :param x:  int      - The x coordinate on the grid
516        :param y:  int      - The y coordinate on the grid
517        """
518        
519        if (x, y) == self._position:
520            return
521        item2 = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = self._kind_name,
522                                        position = (x,y),
523                                        return_first = True)[0]
524        if item2 is not None:
525            item2.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
526            item2.set_starting_position(
527                self._position[0], 
528                self._position[1])
529            item2.clear_actions()
530        
531        self.set_position(x,y)
532        self.set_starting_position(x, y)
533        self.get_model().reset()
534        self.get_model().mapf_reset_connection()
535
536    def enable_drag(self, enable):
537        """
538        Enables and disables the drag and drop feature for the
539        model editor.
540        
541        :param enable: bool  -   enable or disable drag & drop
542        """     
543        self._enable_drag = enable
544
545    def boundingRect(self):
546        """
547        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
548        """
549        return self._graphics_item.boundingRect()

556        This function will be called by the model every time an item does an action forward and has to publish
557        the updated information about itself.
558
559        :param msg_id:      int  -   The id of the current cycle (sim->controller->planner->controller->sim)
560        :param time_step:   int  -   Sets the time step in the published message (msg.step = time_step)
561        """
562        return

This is the template class for visualizer graphic items. There should never be an instance of this class. A visualizer graphic item is a part of the visualizer model that is drawn on the model view and can perform actions.

**Attributes**:
-   **_kind_name**: str         -   The name of this kind of object.
-   **_ID**: int                -   The id of this object.
-   **_model**: model.Model     -   The model this object belongs to
-   **_position**: tuple        -   A tuple that consists of two integers representing
                                    the position of the item on the grid.
-   **_start_position**: tuple  -   The position of this item at timestep 0.
-   **_dragged**: tuple         -   This is the position of this item before a drag
                                    action started.
-   **_enable_drag**: bool      -   This is true if drag and drop is enabled for this item.        
                                    This will be set by the model. 
-   **_graphics_item**: QGraphicsItem - This is the main graphic item of this item
                                        and is used for some default functions.
-   **_text**: QGraphicsTextItem -  This is a text item that is drawn 
                                    on the model view and represents primarily the id of the item.
-   **_actions**: list          -   This is a sorted list of the actions of this item. The index
                                    of every action is the time step at which the action occurs.    
-   **_color**: QColor          -   The current main color of the item.
-   **_colors**: list           -   A list of QColor values. Contains several colors for multi-colored
                                    items and color interpolation.
-   **_display_mode**: int      -   This is set by the model view and determines whether
                                    the item text should be rendered and whether the item 
                                    should be rendered in the whole grid field.
                                    It is primarily defined by the zoom factor and the grid size.
-   **_draw_path**: bool        -   This is true if the driven path of the item should be drawn in the simulation. 
                                    Should only be used for items that can have a path like robots.
-   **_draw_future_path**: bool -   This is true if the calculated path for the item should be drawn in the simulation. 
                                    Should only be used for items that can have a path like robots.
-   **_draw_startpoint**: bool  -   This is true if the start point of the item should be drawn in the simulation. 
                                    Should only be used for items that can have a start point like robots.
-   **_state**: int             -   Consists of one or more state flags, that describes which action
                                    a item is currently doing.
-   **_highlighted**: bool      -   This is true if the item will be highlighted.
                                    Highlighted elements are displayed larger

.

def set_action(self, action, time_step): 
194    def set_action(self, action, time_step):
195        """
196        Sets the action for the specific time step.
197        Overrides existing actions at the time step but prints out
198        a warning since this should never happen.
199
200        :param action:      mapf_simulation.action.Action   -   This is the action that will be performed.
201        :param time_step:   int                             -   This is the time step at which the action should be performed.
202        """
203        if time_step < 0:
204            print(('Warning: invalid time step in occurs(object('
205                    + str(self._kind_name) + ','
206                    + str(self._id) + '),' + str(action)
207                    + ',' + str(time_step) + ')'))
208            print('time step is less than 0')
209            return
210        for ii in range((time_step + 1) - len(self._actions)):
211            self._actions.append(None)
212        if not self._actions[time_step] == None:
213            print(('Warning: for object(' + str(self._kind_name)
214                    + ', ' + str(self._id)
215                    + ') multiple actions are defined at time step '
216                    + str(time_step)))
217        self._actions[time_step] = action

def do_action(self, time_step):

def clear_older_actions(self, time_step):

475        """
476        Deletes all actions for the given time step (self._actions[time_step]) 
477        and after the given time step (self._actions[i>time_step]) for an object.
478        
479        :param time_step:   int -   Sets the steps (time>=time_step) for which the actions should be deleted.
480        """

482            return
483        if len(self._actions)-1 < time_step:
484            return
485        if time_step == 0:
486            self._actions = []
487            return
488    
489        self._actions = self._actions[0:time_step]
490        return

509        """

class RobotROS(rclpy.node.Node, VisualizerGraphicItem): 
 565class RobotROS(Node, VisualizerGraphicItem):
 566    """
 567    This class represents a robot.
 568
 569    **Attributes**:
 570    -   **_kind_name**: str                     -   The name of this kind of item. This is always 'robot_ros'.
 571    -   **_tasks**:    list                    -   The list of tasks of the robot.
 572    -   **_graphics_item**: QGraphicsEllipseItem-   This is the main graphic item of the robot
 573                                                    and is used for some default functions.
 574    -   **_text**:          QGraphicsTextItem   -   This is a text item that is drawn on the model view
 575                                                    and represents primarily the id of the robot.
 576    """
 577
 578    def __init__(self, ID = 0, x = 0, y = 0, theta = 0.0, bucket = 0, heuristic = 0.0):
 579        """
 580        :param ID:      int, optional       - The ID of the robot
 581        :param x:       int, optional       - The x coordinate on the grid
 582        :param y:       int, optional       - The y coordinate on the grid
 583        :param theta:   float, optional     - The orientation of the robot in angle (°)
 584        :param bucket:  int, optional       - The bucket to which the robot belongs
 585        :param heuristic: float, optional   - Optimal length from the start to the goal position
 586        """
 587
 588        #------------------------------ ROS2 --------------------------------------------------------------
 589        #Init ROS2 Node with the name mapf_robot_ID, here ID is the ID of the robot
 590        Node.__init__(self, 'mapf_robot_' + str(ID) + '_node')
 591
 592        #Create a publisher for the topic "mapf_robot_info_ID" to publish the information 
 593        #of the robot with the custom message type "RobotInfo.msg"
 594        self.publisher = self.create_publisher(RobotInfo, 'mapf_robot_info_' + str(ID) , 1)
 595        '''**rclpy.publisher.Publisher** - ros2 publisher to the topic */mapf_robot_info_''ID''*'''
 596
 597        #Create a subscriber for the topic "mapf_robot_action_ID" to get the information about 
 598        #the next action to be executed by the robot, custom message type: RobotAction.msg
 599        self.subscriber = self.create_subscription(RobotAction, 'mapf_robot_action_' + str(ID) , self.callback_action, 100)
 600        '''**rclpy.subscription.Subscription** - ros2 subscriber to the topic */mapf_robot_action_''ID''*'''
 601
 602        #True if RobotAction.msg received for the next step, otherwise False
 603        self._ready = False
 604
 605
 606        #------------------------------ GRAPHIC ITEM ------------------------------------------------------
 607        VisualizerGraphicItem.__init__(self, ID, x, y)
 608        self._kind_name = 'robot_ros'
 609        self._tasks = []
 610        
 611        self._graphics_item = QGraphicsEllipseItem(self)
 612        self._graphics_line_item = QGraphicsLineItem(self)
 613        self._text = QGraphicsTextItem(self)
 614        self._pen = QPen()
 615        self.setZValue(2.0)
 616        
 617        self._draw_path = True
 618        self._draw_future_path = True
 619        self._draw_startpoint = True
 620        
 621        #------------------------------ SAVE DATA ------------------------------------------------------
 622        self.set_position(x,y,theta)
 623        self.set_starting_position(x,y,theta)
 624        self.set_bucket(bucket)
 625        self.set_heuristic(heuristic)
 626
 627        self._step = -1
 628
 629    '''    
 630    def __del__(self):
 631        self.destroy_node()
 632    '''

 697    def set_action(self, action, time_step):
 698        """
 699        Sets the action for the specific time step.
 700        Overrides existing actions at the time step but prints out
 701        a warning since this should never happen.
 702
 703        :param action:      mapf_simulation.action.Action   -   This is the action that will be performed.
 704        :param time_step:   int                             -   This is the time step at which the action should be performed.
 705        """
 706        
 707        
 708        print("----------------------------------- SET ACTION -----------------------------------")
 709        if time_step < 0:
 710            print('Warning: invalid time step(smaller than 0), Object: ' 
 711                  + str(self._kind_name) + 
 712                  ', ID: ' + str(self._id) + 
 713                  ', Action: ' + str(action.get_name()) + 
 714                  ', Value: ' + str(action.get_value()) + 
 715                  ', Time Step: ' + str(time_step))
 716            print('time step is less than 0')
 717            return
 718        for ii in range((time_step + 1) - len(self._actions)):
 719            self._actions.append(None)
 720        if not self._actions[time_step] == None:
 721            print(('Warning: for object(' + str(self._kind_name)
 722                    + ', ' + str(self._id)
 723                    + ') multiple actions are defined at time step '
 724                    + str(time_step)))
 725        self._actions[time_step] = action
 726

 800    def get_rect(self):
 801        """
 802        Returns the current rectangle of the robot. 
 803
 804        :return: **QtCore.QRect** - The adjusted current rectangle of the QGraphicsItem which should represent the robot.
 805        """
 806        if self._display_mode == 0:
 807            rect = self._graphics_item.rect()
 808            width = rect.width()*2
 809            height = rect.height()*2
 810            rect.setLeft(rect.x() - 0.25*width)
 811            rect.setTop(rect.y() - 0.25*height)
 812            rect.setWidth(width)
 813            rect.setHeight(height)
 814            return rect
 815        elif self._display_mode == 1:
 816            rect = self._graphics_item.rect()
 817            width = rect.width()/0.9
 818            height = rect.height()/0.9
 819            rect.setLeft(rect.x() - 0.05*width)
 820            rect.setTop(rect.y() - 0.05*height)
 821            rect.setWidth(width)
 822            rect.setHeight(height)
 823            return rect

 830        
 831        :return: **bool**   -   True or False.
 832        """
 833        return self._ready

 836    #EVENTS (Drag&Drop)
 837    def mouseReleaseEvent(self, event):
 838        """
 839        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
 840        """
 841        model_view = None
 842        self._dragged = None
 843        for view in self.scene().views():
 844            if isinstance(view, mapf_simulation.modelView.ModelView):
 845                model_view = view
 846        if model_view is None:
 847            return
 848        node = model_view.scene_coordinates_to_node(event.scenePos().x(),
 849                                                    event.scenePos().y())
 850        self.setPos(0, 0)
 851
 852        if node is not None:
 853            #if item not moved but only clicked then highlight it and all the corresponding checkpoints
 854            if (self._position[0] == node[0] and self._position[1] == node[1]):
 855                self._highlighted = not self._highlighted
 856                for task in self._tasks:
 857                    for checkpoint, name in task.get_checkpoints():
 858                        checkpoint.set_highlighted(self._highlighted)
 859            elif self._enable_drag:
 860                if self._model.is_node_free_of_robots(node[0], node[1]):
 861                    self.edit_position_to(node[0], node[1])
 862        model_view.update()
 863        event.accept()
 864
 865    def edit_position_to(self, x, y):
 866        """
 867        Sets a new starting position and new current position for the 
 868        robot. If another robot is already on the same position
 869        they swap positions. This function is used to edit instances with
 870        the drag and drop feature. 
 871
 872        :param x:       int                - The x coordinate on the grid (new position for the robot)
 873        :param y:       int                - The y coordinate on the grid (new position for the robot)
 874        """
 875        if (x == self._position[0] and y == self._position[1]):
 876            return
 877        item2 = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = self._kind_name,
 878                                        position = (x,y),
 879                                        return_first = True)[0]
 880        
 881        if item2 is not None:
 882            item2.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
 883            item2.set_starting_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
 884            #item2.clear_actions()
 885        self.set_position(x,y, self.get_theta())
 886        self.set_starting_position(x, y, self.get_theta())
 887        #self.clear_actions()
 888
 889        self.get_model().reset()
 890        self.get_model().mapf_reset_connection()
 891
 892
 893    #VISUAL
 894    def set_rect(self, rect):
 895        """    
 896        Sets the rectangle that a robot can use to draw things in.
 897        This equals one field of the grid in the model view.
 898        This function defines the appearance of the robot
 899        on the grid.
 900
 901        :param rect:    QtCore.QRect    - The rectangle that a robot can use to draw things in.
 902        """
 903        scale = config.get('display', 'id_font_scale')
 904        bold = config.get('display', 'id_font_bold')
 905
 906        #SET FONTSIZE, TEXT POSITION AND DEFAULT TEXT COLOR
 907        self._text.setFont(QFont('', rect.width()*0.3*scale))
 908        self._text.setPos(rect.x(), rect.y() + 0.1*rect.height())
 909        self._text.setDefaultTextColor(QColor(config.get('display', 'id_font_color')))
 910
 911        #SET DISPLAY MODE
 912        if self._display_mode == 0:
 913            if bold:
 914                self._text.setHtml('<b>' + str(self._id) + '</b>')
 915            else:
 916                self._text.setHtml(str(self._id))
 917        else:
 918            self._text.setPlainText('')
 919
 920        #SET POSITION AND SIZE OF GRAPHICS ITEM INSIDE THE CELL 
 921        rect2 = QRectF()
 922        rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.05*rect.width(), 
 923                            rect.y() + 0.05*rect.height(),
 924                            rect.width()*0.9,
 925                            rect.height()*0.9)
 926        
 927        self._pen.setWidth(rect.width()*0.1)
 928        
 929        #IF HIGHLIGHTED
 930        if self._highlighted:
 931            rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.0*rect.width(), 
 932                            rect.y() + 0.0*rect.height(),
 933                            rect.width()*1.0,
 934                            rect.height()*1.0)
 935            self._pen.setWidth(rect.width()*0.25)
 936            
 937        self._graphics_item.setRect(rect2)
 938        self._graphics_item.setPen(self._pen)
 939
 940        try:
 941            action = self._actions[self._step+1].arguments[0]
 942            value = self._actions[self._step+1].arguments[1]
 943            if action.name == 'move' and len(value.arguments) == 2:
 944                try:
 945                    move_x = value.arguments[0].number
 946                    move_y = value.arguments[1].number
 947                    if not (move_x == 0 and move_y == 0):
 948                        self.set_theta(math.atan2(float(move_y),float(move_x))*180.0/math.pi)    
 949                except:
 950                    pass
 951        except:
 952            pass
 953        
 954        #DRAW THE RIGHT ORIENTATION OF THE ROBOT IN THE DIRECTION OF MOVING
 955        self._graphics_line_item.setLine(rect2.x() + rect2.width()  *0.5,   #start x
 956                                         rect2.y() + rect2.height() *0.5,  #start y 
 957                                         rect2.x() + rect2.width()  *0.5 + math.cos(self._position[2]/180*math.pi)* rect2.width()*0.5,      #end x
 958                                         rect2.y() + rect2.height() *0.5 + math.sin(self._position[2]/180*math.pi)* rect2.height()*0.5)      #end y                                  
 959        #UPDATE TOOLTIP
 960        self.update_tooltip()
 961
 962    def update_tooltip(self):
 963        """
 964        Updates the tooltip for the robot.
 965        """
 966        tooltip = ("robot(" + str(self._id) + 
 967                   ")\nPosition: " + str(self.get_position()))
 968        self.setToolTip(tooltip)
 969
 970    def determine_color(self, number, count, pattern = None):
 971        """
 972        Determines the color of the robot.
 973        
 974        :param number: int  -   The number of this item in the models sequence. 
 975                                This does not necessarily have to be the ID of the item.
 976        :param count: int   -   The maximal count of all items in the model of this kind.
 977        :param pattern: int -   Not used.
 978        """
 979        color = calculate_color(self._colors[0], self._colors[1], (float)(number)/count)
 980        self._color = color
 981        brush = QBrush(color)
 982        self._graphics_item.setBrush(brush)
 983
 984    
 985    #ACTIONS / UPDATE   
 986    def clear_actions(self):
 987        """
 988        Deletes all saved actions for the robot.
 989        """
 990        self._actions = []
 991
 992    def do_action(self, time_step):
 993        """
 994        Executes an action for the robot.
 995        This function will be called every time the model does
 996        one time step forward.
 997        
 998        :param time_step:   int     - The time step for which an action should be executed.
 999        :return:   **int**          - 1 if an action was done and 0 if an error occured.
1000        """
1001        self._state = self._state & ~VIZ_STATE_ACTION
1002
1003        #SETS THE STATE FOR THE NEXT ACTION
1004        if time_step + 1 < len(self._actions):
1005            if self._actions[time_step + 1] is not None:
1006                #SETS THE STATE FOR THE NEXT ACTION
1007                self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVE
1008        
1009        if time_step >= len(self._actions):
1010            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1011        if self._actions[time_step] is None:
1012            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1013        if self._model is None:
1014            return 0
1015
1016        #TRY TO GET THE ACTION
1017        try:
1018            action = self._actions[time_step].arguments[0]
1019            value = self._actions[time_step].arguments[1]
1020        except:
1021            return 0
1022
1023        #EXECUTE ACTION
1024        if action.name == 'move':
1025            if len(value.arguments) != 2: 
1026                return 0
1027          
1028            #MOVE 
1029            try:
1030                move_x = value.arguments[0].number
1031                move_y = value.arguments[1].number
1032                #MOVE AND CHANGE ORIENTATION IF VALUE NOT ZERO
1033                if not (move_x == 0 and move_y == 0):
1034                    self.set_position(self._position[0] + move_x, self._position[1] + move_y, math.atan2(float(move_y),float(move_x))*180.0/math.pi)
1035                    self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVED
1036            except:
1037                #NO ACTION, NO CHANGE IN POSITION
1038                self.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1], self._position[2])
1039            
1040            #MARK VISITED CHECKPOINTS
1041            for task in self._tasks:
1042                for checkpoint, name in task.get_checkpoints():
1043                    pos = checkpoint.get_position()
1044                    if pos[0] == self._position[0] and pos[1] == self._position[1]:
1045                        task.visit_checkpoint(checkpoint)
1046                        break
1047
1048            self._step = time_step
1049            return 1
1050        return 0
1051
1052    def undo_action(self, time_step):
1053        """
1054        Reverse an executed action for the robot.
1055        This function will be called every time the model does
1056        one time step backwards.  
1057
1058        :param time_step:   int     - The time step for which an action should be reversed.
1059        :return:   **int**          - 1 if an action was done and 0 if an error occured.
1060        """
1061        self._state = self._state & ~VIZ_STATE_ACTION
1062        if time_step >= len(self._actions):  
1063            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1064        if self._actions[time_step] == None: 
1065            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1066        if self._model is None:
1067            return 0
1068
1069        try:
1070            action = self._actions[time_step].arguments[0]
1071            value = self._actions[time_step].arguments[1]
1072        except:
1073            return 0
1074
1075        #EXECUTE ACTION
1076        if action.name == 'move':
1077            if len(value.arguments) != 2: 
1078                return 0
1079            
1080            #UNMARK VISITED CHECKPOINTS
1081            for task in self._tasks:
1082                for checkpoint in task.get_checkpoints():
1083                    #checkpoint[0] -> checkpoint object, checkpoint[1] -> name of the checkpoint
1084                    checkpoint = checkpoint[0]
1085                    pos = checkpoint.get_position()
1086                    if pos[0] == self._position[0] and pos[1] == self._position[1]:
1087                        task.unvisit_checkpoint(checkpoint)
1088                        break
1089
1090            #MOVE BACK
1091            try:
1092                move_x = value.arguments[0].number
1093                move_y = value.arguments[1].number
1094                #MOVE BACK AND CHANGE ORIENTATION IF VALUE NOT ZERO
1095                if not (move_x == 0 and move_y == 0):
1096                    self.set_position(self._position[0] - move_x, self._position[1] - move_y, math.atan2(float(move_y),float(move_x))*180.0/math.pi)
1097                    self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVE
1098            except:
1099                #NO ACTION, NO CHANGE IN POSITION
1100                self.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1], self._position[2])
1101            
1102            return 1
1103        return 0
1104
1105    def reset(self):
1106        """
1107        Resets the item to its original values. This function will be called for every item if 
1108        the Button "RESET" in the GUI is pressed
1109        -   delete old actions for the robot
1110        -   move the robot back to it's start position
1111        -   mark all the checkpoints of the robot as not visited yet
1112        """
1113        self.clear_actions()
1114        self.set_position(self._start_position[0], self._start_position[1], self._start_position[2])
1115        self.unvisit_all_checkpoints()
1116
1117    def restart(self):
1118        """
1119        Sets the robot to it's starting position.
1120        """
1121        super(self.__class__, self).restart()
1122
1123
1124    #TASK / CHECKPOINTS
1125    def add_task(self, task):
1126        """
1127        Adds a task to the robot (For the moment only one task is supported).
1128
1129        :param task:   mapf_simulation.visualizerItem.TaskROS  -    A new task for the robot
1130        """
1131        if task is None:
1132            return
1133        if task in self._tasks:
1134            return
1135        self._tasks.append(task)
1136        task.set_robot(self)
1137
1138    def check_robot_at_target(self):
1139        """
1140        This function checks whether the robot has reached it's target. 
1141        At the moment for one robot only one checkpoint and only one task are supported.
1142        Therefore this function checks only if the robot has reached the position 
1143        of the first checkpoint from it's first task from his task list.
1144        
1145        :return: **True**   -   if the robot has reached it's target   
1146                 **False**  -   otherwise
1147        """
1148        task = self.get_task(index =0)
1149        checkpoint = task.get_checkpoints()[0][0]
1150        if (checkpoint.get_position()[0] == self.get_position()[0] and 
1151            checkpoint.get_position()[1] == self.get_position()[1]):
1152            return True
1153        return False
1154
1155    def unvisit_all_checkpoints(self):
1156        """
1157        This function iterates over the tasks of this robot and 
1158        marks all the checkpoints assigned to the tasks as not visited.
1159        """
1160        for task in self._tasks:
1161            task.unvisit_all_checkpoints()

1166        """

1168        """
1169        rclpy.spin_once(self, timeout_sec=0)
1170
1171    def ros_publish_message_info(self, msg_id, time_step):
1172        """
1173        This function generates a ROS2 message of type [mapf_interfaces/RobotInfo.msg] 
1174        and publishes it to the following topic: */mapf_robot_info_"ID"*
1175        
1176        This function will be called by the model every time a robot performs an action and then has to publish
1177        the updated information about itself.
1178
1179        :param msg_id:      int  -   The id of the current cycle (sim->controller->planner->controller->sim)
1180        :param time_step:   int  -   Sets the time step in the published message (msg.step = time_step)
1181        """
1182
1183        msg  = RobotInfo()
1184        pos  = Position()
1185        checkpoint_msg = CheckpointInfo()
1186        goal = Position()
1187        
1188        #Add CYCLE-ID        
1189        msg.id = msg_id
1190        #Add STEP        
1191        msg.step = time_step
1192        #Add ROBOT_ID
1193        msg.robot_id = int(self.get_id())
1194        #Add BUCKET
1195        msg.bucket = int(self.get_bucket())
1196        #Add OPTIMAL_LENGTH
1197        msg.optimal_length = float(self.get_heuristic())
1198        #Add POSITION
1199        pos.pos_x, pos.pos_y, pos.theta = self.get_position()
1200        msg.position = pos
1201
1202        #Add CHECKPOINTS
1203        task = self.get_task(index =0)
1204        checkpoints = task.get_checkpoints()
1205        for checkpoint, name in checkpoints:    
1206            checkpoint_msg.position.pos_x, checkpoint_msg.position.pos_y = checkpoint.get_position()
1207            checkpoint_msg.position.theta = 0.0
1208            checkpoint_msg.visited = checkpoint.get_visit_status()
1209            msg.checkpoints.append(checkpoint_msg)
1210
1211        #publish message: RobotInfo.msg
1212        self.publisher.publish(msg)
1213        return
1214
1215    #TODO: check action = move or action = rotate
1216    def callback_action(self, msg):
1217        """
1218        This function will be called every time a message on the following topics is received: 
1219        */mapf_robot_info_"ID"*
1220
1221        This function creates an action from the received message and 
1222        saves the action in the robot for the (in the message) defined step!
1223        
1224        :param msg: mapf_interfaces/RobotAction.msg - message from the topic /mapf_robot_action_ID
1225        """
1226
1227        print("Message received")
1228        print("STEP: %d" % msg.step)
1229        print("robot_id: %d"  % msg.robot_id)
1230        print("move x: %d"  % msg.move_x)
1231        print("move y: %d"  % msg.move_y)
1232        print("rotate: %d" % msg.rotate)
1233        
1234        #skip message if action not for current step
1235        if msg.step != self._model.get_current_step():
1236            print("SKIP MESSAGE, WRONG STEP")
1237            print("Robot ID: " + str(msg.robot_id))
1238            print("Msg step: " + str(msg.step))
1239            print("Current step: " + str(self._model.get_current_step()))
1240            return
1241        
1242        action = Action(msg.move_x, msg.move_y, 'move')
1243        self.set_action(action, msg.step)
1244        self.set_future_path(msg.path)
1245        self.set_ready(True)

This class represents a robot.

Attributes:

  • _kind_name: str - The name of this kind of item. This is always 'robot_ros'.
  • _tasks: list - The list of tasks of the robot.
  • _graphics_item: QGraphicsEllipseItem- This is the main graphic item of the robot and is used for some default functions.
  • _text: QGraphicsTextItem - This is a text item that is drawn on the model view and represents primarily the id of the robot.
RobotROS(ID=0, x=0, y=0, theta=0.0, bucket=0, heuristic=0.0) 
578    def __init__(self, ID = 0, x = 0, y = 0, theta = 0.0, bucket = 0, heuristic = 0.0):
579        """
580        :param ID:      int, optional       - The ID of the robot
581        :param x:       int, optional       - The x coordinate on the grid
582        :param y:       int, optional       - The y coordinate on the grid
583        :param theta:   float, optional     - The orientation of the robot in angle (°)
584        :param bucket:  int, optional       - The bucket to which the robot belongs
585        :param heuristic: float, optional   - Optimal length from the start to the goal position
586        """
587
588        #------------------------------ ROS2 --------------------------------------------------------------
589        #Init ROS2 Node with the name mapf_robot_ID, here ID is the ID of the robot
590        Node.__init__(self, 'mapf_robot_' + str(ID) + '_node')
591
592        #Create a publisher for the topic "mapf_robot_info_ID" to publish the information 
593        #of the robot with the custom message type "RobotInfo.msg"
594        self.publisher = self.create_publisher(RobotInfo, 'mapf_robot_info_' + str(ID) , 1)
595        '''**rclpy.publisher.Publisher** - ros2 publisher to the topic */mapf_robot_info_''ID''*'''
596
597        #Create a subscriber for the topic "mapf_robot_action_ID" to get the information about 
598        #the next action to be executed by the robot, custom message type: RobotAction.msg
599        self.subscriber = self.create_subscription(RobotAction, 'mapf_robot_action_' + str(ID) , self.callback_action, 100)
600        '''**rclpy.subscription.Subscription** - ros2 subscriber to the topic */mapf_robot_action_''ID''*'''
601
602        #True if RobotAction.msg received for the next step, otherwise False
603        self._ready = False
604
605
606        #------------------------------ GRAPHIC ITEM ------------------------------------------------------
607        VisualizerGraphicItem.__init__(self, ID, x, y)
608        self._kind_name = 'robot_ros'
609        self._tasks = []
610        
611        self._graphics_item = QGraphicsEllipseItem(self)
612        self._graphics_line_item = QGraphicsLineItem(self)
613        self._text = QGraphicsTextItem(self)
614        self._pen = QPen()
615        self.setZValue(2.0)
616        
617        self._draw_path = True
618        self._draw_future_path = True
619        self._draw_startpoint = True
620        
621        #------------------------------ SAVE DATA ------------------------------------------------------
622        self.set_position(x,y,theta)
623        self.set_starting_position(x,y,theta)
624        self.set_bucket(bucket)
625        self.set_heuristic(heuristic)
626
627        self._step = -1
Parameters
  • ID: int, optional - The ID of the robot
  • x: int, optional - The x coordinate on the grid
  • y: int, optional - The y coordinate on the grid
  • theta: float, optional - The orientation of the robot in angle (°)
  • bucket: int, optional - The bucket to which the robot belongs
  • heuristic: float, optional - Optimal length from the start to the goal position

def set_action(self, action, time_step): 
697    def set_action(self, action, time_step):
698        """
699        Sets the action for the specific time step.
700        Overrides existing actions at the time step but prints out
701        a warning since this should never happen.
702
703        :param action:      mapf_simulation.action.Action   -   This is the action that will be performed.
704        :param time_step:   int                             -   This is the time step at which the action should be performed.
705        """
706        
707        
708        print("----------------------------------- SET ACTION -----------------------------------")
709        if time_step < 0:
710            print('Warning: invalid time step(smaller than 0), Object: ' 
711                  + str(self._kind_name) + 
712                  ', ID: ' + str(self._id) + 
713                  ', Action: ' + str(action.get_name()) + 
714                  ', Value: ' + str(action.get_value()) + 
715                  ', Time Step: ' + str(time_step))
716            print('time step is less than 0')
717            return
718        for ii in range((time_step + 1) - len(self._actions)):
719            self._actions.append(None)
720        if not self._actions[time_step] == None:
721            print(('Warning: for object(' + str(self._kind_name)
722                    + ', ' + str(self._id)
723                    + ') multiple actions are defined at time step '
724                    + str(time_step)))
725        self._actions[time_step] = action

Sets the action for the specific time step. Overrides existing actions at the time step but prints out a warning since this should never happen.

Parameters
  • action: mapf_simulation.action.Action - This is the action that will be performed.
  • time_step: int - This is the time step at which the action should be performed.

def get_rect(self): 
800    def get_rect(self):
801        """
802        Returns the current rectangle of the robot. 
803
804        :return: **QtCore.QRect** - The adjusted current rectangle of the QGraphicsItem which should represent the robot.
805        """
806        if self._display_mode == 0:
807            rect = self._graphics_item.rect()
808            width = rect.width()*2
809            height = rect.height()*2
810            rect.setLeft(rect.x() - 0.25*width)
811            rect.setTop(rect.y() - 0.25*height)
812            rect.setWidth(width)
813            rect.setHeight(height)
814            return rect
815        elif self._display_mode == 1:
816            rect = self._graphics_item.rect()
817            width = rect.width()/0.9
818            height = rect.height()/0.9
819            rect.setLeft(rect.x() - 0.05*width)
820            rect.setTop(rect.y() - 0.05*height)
821            rect.setWidth(width)
822            rect.setHeight(height)

def mouseReleaseEvent(self, event): 
837    def mouseReleaseEvent(self, event):
838        """
839        This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.
840        """
841        model_view = None
842        self._dragged = None
843        for view in self.scene().views():
844            if isinstance(view, mapf_simulation.modelView.ModelView):
845                model_view = view
846        if model_view is None:
847            return
848        node = model_view.scene_coordinates_to_node(event.scenePos().x(),
849                                                    event.scenePos().y())
850        self.setPos(0, 0)
851
852        if node is not None:
853            #if item not moved but only clicked then highlight it and all the corresponding checkpoints
854            if (self._position[0] == node[0] and self._position[1] == node[1]):
855                self._highlighted = not self._highlighted
856                for task in self._tasks:
857                    for checkpoint, name in task.get_checkpoints():
858                        checkpoint.set_highlighted(self._highlighted)
859            elif self._enable_drag:
860                if self._model.is_node_free_of_robots(node[0], node[1]):
861                    self.edit_position_to(node[0], node[1])
862        model_view.update()
863        event.accept()

This is a overridden QT function and used for drag and drop.

def edit_position_to(self, x, y): 
865    def edit_position_to(self, x, y):
866        """
867        Sets a new starting position and new current position for the 
868        robot. If another robot is already on the same position
869        they swap positions. This function is used to edit instances with
870        the drag and drop feature. 
871
872        :param x:       int                - The x coordinate on the grid (new position for the robot)
873        :param y:       int                - The y coordinate on the grid (new position for the robot)
874        """
875        if (x == self._position[0] and y == self._position[1]):
876            return
877        item2 = self._model.filter_items(item_kind = self._kind_name,
878                                        position = (x,y),
879                                        return_first = True)[0]
880        
881        if item2 is not None:
882            item2.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
883            item2.set_starting_position(self._position[0], self._position[1])
884            #item2.clear_actions()
885        self.set_position(x,y, self.get_theta())
886        self.set_starting_position(x, y, self.get_theta())
887        #self.clear_actions()
888
889        self.get_model().reset()
890        self.get_model().mapf_reset_connection()

Sets a new starting position and new current position for the robot. If another robot is already on the same position they swap positions. This function is used to edit instances with the drag and drop feature.

  • y: int - The y coordinate on the grid (new position for the robot)
def set_rect(self, rect): 
894    def set_rect(self, rect):
895        """    
896        Sets the rectangle that a robot can use to draw things in.
897        This equals one field of the grid in the model view.
898        This function defines the appearance of the robot
899        on the grid.
900
901        :param rect:    QtCore.QRect    - The rectangle that a robot can use to draw things in.
902        """
903        scale = config.get('display', 'id_font_scale')
904        bold = config.get('display', 'id_font_bold')
905
906        #SET FONTSIZE, TEXT POSITION AND DEFAULT TEXT COLOR
907        self._text.setFont(QFont('', rect.width()*0.3*scale))

909        self._text.setDefaultTextColor(QColor(config.get('display', 'id_font_color')))
910

913            if bold:

921        rect2 = QRectF()
922        rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.05*rect.width(), 
923                            rect.y() + 0.05*rect.height(),
924                            rect.width()*0.9,
925                            rect.height()*0.9)
926        
927        self._pen.setWidth(rect.width()*0.1)
928        
929        #IF HIGHLIGHTED
930        if self._highlighted:
931            rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.0*rect.width(), 
932                            rect.y() + 0.0*rect.height(),
933                            rect.width()*1.0,
934                            rect.height()*1.0)
935            self._pen.setWidth(rect.width()*0.25)

947                    if not (move_x == 0 and move_y == 0):
948                        self.set_theta(math.atan2(float(move_y),float(move_x))*180.0/math.pi)    
949                except:
950                    pass
951        except:
952            pass
953        
954        #DRAW THE RIGHT ORIENTATION OF THE ROBOT IN THE DIRECTION OF MOVING
955        self._graphics_line_item.setLine(rect2.x() + rect2.width()  *0.5,   #start x
956                                         rect2.y() + rect2.height() *0.5,  #start y 
957                                         rect2.x() + rect2.width()  *0.5 + math.cos(self._position[2]/180*math.pi)* rect2.width()*0.5,      #end x
958                                         rect2.y() + rect2.height() *0.5 + math.sin(self._position[2]/180*math.pi)* rect2.height()*0.5)      #end y                                  
959        #UPDATE TOOLTIP
960        self.update_tooltip()
