def do_action(self, time_step): 
 992    def do_action(self, time_step):
 993        """
 994        Executes an action for the robot.
 995        This function will be called every time the model does
 996        one time step forward.
 997        
 998        :param time_step:   int     - The time step for which an action should be executed.
 999        :return:   **int**          - 1 if an action was done and 0 if an error occured.
1000        """
1001        self._state = self._state & ~VIZ_STATE_ACTION
1002
1003        #SETS THE STATE FOR THE NEXT ACTION
1004        if time_step + 1 < len(self._actions):
1005            if self._actions[time_step + 1] is not None:
1006                #SETS THE STATE FOR THE NEXT ACTION
1007                self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVE
1008        
1009        if time_step >= len(self._actions):
1010            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1011        if self._actions[time_step] is None:
1012            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1013        if self._model is None:
1014            return 0
1015
1016        #TRY TO GET THE ACTION
1017        try:
1018            action = self._actions[time_step].arguments[0]
1019            value = self._actions[time_step].arguments[1]
1020        except:
1021            return 0
1022
1023        #EXECUTE ACTION
1024        if action.name == 'move':
1025            if len(value.arguments) != 2: 
1026                return 0
1027          
1028            #MOVE 
1029            try:
1030                move_x = value.arguments[0].number
1031                move_y = value.arguments[1].number
1032                #MOVE AND CHANGE ORIENTATION IF VALUE NOT ZERO
1033                if not (move_x == 0 and move_y == 0):
1034                    self.set_position(self._position[0] + move_x, self._position[1] + move_y, math.atan2(float(move_y),float(move_x))*180.0/math.pi)
1035                    self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVED
1036            except:
1037                #NO ACTION, NO CHANGE IN POSITION
1038                self.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1], self._position[2])
1039            
1040            #MARK VISITED CHECKPOINTS
1041            for task in self._tasks:
1042                for checkpoint, name in task.get_checkpoints():
1043                    pos = checkpoint.get_position()
1044                    if pos[0] == self._position[0] and pos[1] == self._position[1]:
1045                        task.visit_checkpoint(checkpoint)
1046                        break
1047
1048            self._step = time_step
1049            return 1
1050        return 0

Executes an action for the robot. This function will be called every time the model does one time step forward.

Parameters
  • time_step: int - The time step for which an action should be executed.
Returns

int - 1 if an action was done and 0 if an error occured.

def undo_action(self, time_step): 
1052    def undo_action(self, time_step):
1053        """
1054        Reverse an executed action for the robot.
1055        This function will be called every time the model does
1056        one time step backwards.  
1057
1058        :param time_step:   int     - The time step for which an action should be reversed.
1059        :return:   **int**          - 1 if an action was done and 0 if an error occured.
1060        """
1061        self._state = self._state & ~VIZ_STATE_ACTION
1062        if time_step >= len(self._actions):  
1063            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1064        if self._actions[time_step] == None: 
1065            return 0  #break, if no action is defined
1066        if self._model is None:
1067            return 0
1068
1069        try:
1070            action = self._actions[time_step].arguments[0]
1071            value = self._actions[time_step].arguments[1]
1072        except:
1073            return 0
1074
1075        #EXECUTE ACTION
1076        if action.name == 'move':
1077            if len(value.arguments) != 2: 
1078                return 0
1079            
1080            #UNMARK VISITED CHECKPOINTS
1081            for task in self._tasks:
1082                for checkpoint in task.get_checkpoints():
1083                    #checkpoint[0] -> checkpoint object, checkpoint[1] -> name of the checkpoint
1084                    checkpoint = checkpoint[0]
1085                    pos = checkpoint.get_position()
1086                    if pos[0] == self._position[0] and pos[1] == self._position[1]:
1087                        task.unvisit_checkpoint(checkpoint)
1088                        break
1089
1090            #MOVE BACK
1091            try:
1092                move_x = value.arguments[0].number
1093                move_y = value.arguments[1].number
1094                #MOVE BACK AND CHANGE ORIENTATION IF VALUE NOT ZERO
1095                if not (move_x == 0 and move_y == 0):
1096                    self.set_position(self._position[0] - move_x, self._position[1] - move_y, math.atan2(float(move_y),float(move_x))*180.0/math.pi)
1097                    self._state = self._state | VIZ_STATE_MOVE
1098            except:
1099                #NO ACTION, NO CHANGE IN POSITION
1100                self.set_position(self._position[0], self._position[1], self._position[2])
1101            
1102            return 1
1103        return 0

Reverse an executed action for the robot. This function will be called every time the model does one time step backwards.

Parameters
  • time_step: int - The time step for which an action should be reversed.
Returns

int - 1 if an action was done and 0 if an error occured.

def ros_publish_message_info(self, msg_id, time_step): 
1171    def ros_publish_message_info(self, msg_id, time_step):
1172        """
1173        This function generates a ROS2 message of type [mapf_interfaces/RobotInfo.msg] 
1174        and publishes it to the following topic: */mapf_robot_info_"ID"*
1175        
1176        This function will be called by the model every time a robot performs an action and then has to publish
1177        the updated information about itself.
1178
1179        :param msg_id:      int  -   The id of the current cycle (sim->controller->planner->controller->sim)
1180        :param time_step:   int  -   Sets the time step in the published message (msg.step = time_step)
1181        """
1182
1183        msg  = RobotInfo()
1184        pos  = Position()
1185        checkpoint_msg = CheckpointInfo()
1186        goal = Position()
1187        
1188        #Add CYCLE-ID        
1189        msg.id = msg_id
1190        #Add STEP        
1191        msg.step = time_step
1192        #Add ROBOT_ID
1193        msg.robot_id = int(self.get_id())
1194        #Add BUCKET
1195        msg.bucket = int(self.get_bucket())
1196        #Add OPTIMAL_LENGTH
1197        msg.optimal_length = float(self.get_heuristic())
1198        #Add POSITION
1199        pos.pos_x, pos.pos_y, pos.theta = self.get_position()
1200        msg.position = pos
1201
1202        #Add CHECKPOINTS
1203        task = self.get_task(index =0)
1204        checkpoints = task.get_checkpoints()
1205        for checkpoint, name in checkpoints:    
1206            checkpoint_msg.position.pos_x, checkpoint_msg.position.pos_y = checkpoint.get_position()
1207            checkpoint_msg.position.theta = 0.0
1208            checkpoint_msg.visited = checkpoint.get_visit_status()
1209            msg.checkpoints.append(checkpoint_msg)
1210
1211        #publish message: RobotInfo.msg
1212        self.publisher.publish(msg)
1213        return

class CheckpointROS(VisualizerGraphicItem): 
1248class CheckpointROS(VisualizerGraphicItem):
1249    """
1250    This class represents a Checkpoint.
1251
1252    **Attributes**:
1253    -   **_kind_name**:     str                 -   The name of this kind of item. This is always 'checkpoint_ros'.
1254    -   **_graphics_item**: QGraphicsRectItem   -   This is the main graphic item of the checkpoint
1255                                                    and is used for some default functions.
1256    -   **_text**:          QGraphicsTextItem   -   This is a text item that is drawn on the model view
1257                                                    and represents primarily the id of the checkpoint.
1258    -   **_shine**:         bool                -   This is true if the checkpoint should be highlighted. Checkpoints
1259    """
1260
1261    def __init__(self, ID = 0, x = 0, y = 0, theta = 0.0):
1262        """
1263        :param ID:      int, optional    - The ID of the item
1264        :param x:       int, optional    - The x coordinate on the grid
1265        :param y:       int, optional    - The y coordinate on the grid
1266        :param theta:   int, optional    - Orientation of the item (not used currently)
1267        """
1268        super(self.__class__, self).__init__(ID, x, y)
1269        self._kind_name = 'checkpoint_ros'
1270        self.set_position(x,y)
1271        self.set_starting_position(x,y)
1272
1273        #self._graphics_item = QGraphicsEllipseItem(self)
1274        self._graphics_item = QGraphicsRectItem(self)
1275        self._text = QGraphicsTextItem(self._graphics_item)
1276        self._pen = QPen()
1277        self.setZValue(1.0)
1278
1279        self._shine = False
1280        self._visited = False
1281        #self._checkpoint_number = 0
1282    
1283
1284    #GET
1285    def get_rect(self):
1286        """
1287        Returns the current rectangle of an item.
1288
1289        :return: QtCore.QRect   -   The current rectangle of this item
1290        """
1291        return self._graphics_item.rect()
1292
1293    def get_visit_status(self):
1294        """
1295        Returns whether the item was visited by a roboter or not.
1296
1297        :return: bool   -   True or False
1298        """
1299        return self._visited
1300
1301
1302    #VISUAL
1303    def determine_color(self, number, count, pattern = None):
1304        """
1305        Determines the color of the checkpoint.
1306        
1307        :param number: int  -   The number of this item in the models sequence. 
1308                                This does not necessarily have to be the ID of the item.
1309        :param count: int   -   The maximal count of all items in the model of this kind.
1310        :param pattern: int -   Not used.
1311        """
1312        color = calculate_color(self._colors[0], self._colors[1], (float)(number)/count)
1313        #color = QColor(255,255,255) #white
1314        self._color = color
1315        
1316        #if self._shine:
1317        #    color = QColor(51,255,0)
1318        self._graphics_item.setBrush(QBrush(color))
1319
1320    def set_rect(self, rect):
1321        """    
1322        Sets the rectangle that a checkpoint can use to draw things in.
1323        This equals one field of the grid in the model view.
1324        This function defines the appearance of the checkpoint
1325        on the grid.
1326
1327        :param rect: QtCore.QRect   - The rectangle that a checkpoint can use to draw things in.
1328        """
1329        scale = config.get('display', 'id_font_scale')
1330        bold = config.get('display', 'id_font_bold')
1331        
1332        #SET FONTSIZE, TEXT POSITION AND DEFAULT TEXT COLOR
1333        self._text.setFont(QFont('', rect.width()*0.3*scale))
1334        self._text.setPos(rect.x(), rect.y() + 0.1*rect.height())
1335        self._text.setDefaultTextColor(QColor(config.get('display', 'id_font_color')))
1336
1337        #SET DISPLAY MODE
1338        if self._display_mode == 0:
1339            if bold:
1340                self._text.setHtml('<b>' + str(self._id) + '</b>')
1341            else:
1342                self._text.setHtml(str(self._id))
1343        else:
1344            self._text.setPlainText('')
1345
1346        #SET POSITION AND SIZE OF GRAPHICS ITEM INSIDE THE CELL 
1347        rect2 = QRectF()
1348        rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.05*rect.width(), 
1349                            rect.y() + 0.05*rect.height(),
1350                            rect.width()*0.9,
1351                            rect.height()*0.9)
1352
1353        self._pen.setColor(QColor(255, 0, 0, 255))
1354        self._pen.setWidth(rect.width()*0.1)
1355
1356        #IF HIGHLIGHTED
1357        if self._highlighted:        
1358            rect2 = QRectF(rect.x() + 0.0*rect.width(), 
1359                            rect.y() + 0.0*rect.height(),
1360                            rect.width()*1.0,
1361                            rect.height()*1.0)
1362            self._pen.setColor(QColor(0, 0, 255, 255))
1363            self._pen.setWidth(rect.width()*0.2)
1364
1365        #IF SHINE
1366        if self._shine:    
1367            self._pen.setColor(QColor(0, 255, 0, 255))
1368        
1369        #SAVE 
1370        self._graphics_item.setRect(rect2)        
1371        self._graphics_item.setPen(self._pen)
1372     
1373
1374    #ACTIONS
1375    def do_action(self, time_step):
1376        """
1377        Resets the shine value at every time step.
1378
1379        :param time_step:   int     -   Not used.
1380        """
1381        self._shine = False
1382        return
1383
1384    def undo_action(self, time_step):
1385        """
1386        Resets the shine value at every time step.
1387
1388        :param time_step:   int     -   Not used.
1389        """
1390        self._shine = False
1391        return
1392
1393    def visit(self):
1394        """
1395        Sets the shine value to True.
1396        """    
1397        self._visited = True
1398        self._shine = True
1399
1400    def unvisit(self):
1401        """
1402        Sets the shine value to False.
1403        """ 
1404        self._visited = False
1405        self._shine = False
